item.title: Pesto Gnocchi Recipe
item.dc:creator: cucinaandamore
item.content:encoded:
This Pesto Gnocchi recipe is simple with only 2-ingredients that can be left to your chef-like-heart’s desire. Have fun with adding other ingredients like chicken or shrimp. You can even leave it a vegetarian option with vegetables like artichokes, tomatoes, piquillo peppers, and more. You can keep it simple or dress it up. It’s the perfect dish to be creative because you can’t go wrong. Prep Time: 10 minutes Cook Time: 2-4 minutes Servings: 3-4 Instructions Boil the water in a shallow pan or a small pot. It doesn’t need to be too large but deep enough to see the gnocchi rise. Separate the gnocchi and drop them into the boiling water and cook them for 2-3 minutes You know when the gnocchi is cooked when they rise to the top of the water Drain the gnocchi or scoop them out with a slotted spoon Mix the gnocchi with pesto sauce or a sauce of your choice Add the vegetables and/or meat to your Pesto Gnocchi Enjoy! Ingredients
  • Cucina & Amore Potato Gnocchi
    • Also available in gluten free and whole wheat
  • Cucina & Amore Pesto Genovese[gallery ids="42,41" type="square" columns="2"]
Suggestions Chicken Shrimp Cucina & Amore Piquillo Peppers Cucina & Amore Sundried Tomatoes Cucina & Amore Artichokes Parsley Directions
  1. Boil water
  2. Add gnocchi to boiling water
  3. Let cook for 2-3 minutes Hint: Gnocchi will rise to the top when cooked
  4. Remove gnocchi from water and rinse
  5. Mix with C&A Pesto Genovese sauce
  6. Enjoy!

item.title: Is it really Extra Virgin?
item.dc:creator: cucinaandamore
item.content:encoded:
There are many different brands of olive oil on the market today. With so many options, it’s difficult to know which particular kind of olive oil is the best one to buy, especially when they are all labeled similarly. The grade of olive oil is not determined by the olive, but by the amount of defects within the oil. The highest grade of olive oil is Extra Virgin. By definition extra virgin olive oil must be free from defects (along with passing a large panel of chemical tests). Virgin olive oil is the 2nd highest grade and does contain some minor defects within the oil. It has been tested and proven that most of the olive oil currently sold in this country labeled as “extra virgin” is in fact not. By far the majority of olive oil labeled “extra virgin” on store shelves are defective and thus not extra virgin. A few years ago, the regulations and definitions of olive oil were updated in the federal government to better reflect the current state of the industry. California even instituted a new law for its producers with even stricter standards. One of the results of the updated regulations has been food fraud lawsuits being filed against companies selling these mislabeled products. It is very important to educate yourself and be aware of what you are buying.
Written by Dean Wilkinson, our Olive Oil Expert

item.title: Winter Fancy Food Show Rewind
item.dc:creator: cucinaandamore
item.content:encoded:
[gallery ids="244,245" type="rectangular"] The Winter Fancy Food Show has come and gone. It was definitely a memorable event filled with lots of delicious treats, savory snacks, flavorful refreshments and passionate foodies from all over the country. It was a time for people with a similar purpose to come together and for companies to showcase what they brought to the extensive smorgasbord of all things food and what made them especially fancy. Cucina & Amore was located at Booth #3005 in the South Hall that demonstrated a variety of samples that can be found throughout our booth that could satisfy any meal of the day.

A great way to start your morning by enjoying our Panettone or dipping our biscotti into your morning cup of coffee or tea.

Then for lunch you could get a hearty helping of our convenient ready to go Quinoa Meals with a smile from Michelle.

For an appetizer you could nosh on 3 different all-pepper, non-tomato salsas, grilled artichokes, or take a big dip into our bruschetta, pesto, and truffle sauces.

[gallery ids="194,189" type="rectangular"] [gallery ids="190,191" type="rectangular"]

For dinner, you could find comfort in our potato gnocchi with a variety of pasta sauces including Puttanesca, Arrabbiata, Formaggio, and more.

Cucina & Amore was definitely a booth spreading its love of food to all those who attended. We're looking forward to seeing you at the New York Summer Fancy Food Show in June.

[gallery ids="215,214" type="rectangular"]

A Kitchen of Love from our Family to Yours!

item.title: Chicken Pesto Quinoa Bowl
item.dc:creator: cucinaandamore
item.content:encoded:
Sometimes we want to make something that is fast, easy, and convenient. That's where the Quinoa Meal is a great help. Sometimes we want to take what is simple and add a little more to make it even more delicious! This combination of easy, creative, and with a little bit of extra time to spare, came together to create the Chicken Pesto Quinoa Bowl. Prep: 10 minutes Cook: 20 minutes Serving: 1 or 2 Instructions:
  1. Preheat the oven to 400°F
  2. Bake one chicken breast for 10 minutes on each side. 20 minutes total. If you don't have the time, you could also sauté the chicken in a skillet.
  3. While the chicken is baking, sauté or steam the asparagus. You could also choose other greens like broccoli or spinach.
  4. Once the chicken and asparagus are ready, cut them into bite sized pieces
  5. Mix the quinoa with the amount of chicken and asparagus you would like to eat with the basil pesto. I used 3oz of Chicken and 2oz of asparagus.
  6. Enjoy!
Ingredients:
  • Basil Pesto Quinoa Meal
  • Chicken
  • Asparagus
Suggestions:
  • Broccoli
  • Spinach
  • Artichokes
  • Ground Turkey
  • No meat

A Kitchen of Love from our Family to Yours!

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Yummy! This is TOTALLY up my alley!

item.title: Fire Roasted Yellow Pepper Salsa Chicken
item.dc:creator: cucinaandamore
item.content:encoded:
For me, one of the most satisfying feelings is knowing that I finished something. When I know that I was able to commit and do my best to make it all the way to the end. Sometimes this feeling can be achieved when finishing a book, a workout, or in my case, an entire jar of salsa. I used to open ingredients that only needed to be used for one recipe and then it would just sit in the back of my refrigerator until it went bad and I had to throw it away. Such a waste! This happened to me recently when I opened a jar of Cucina & Amore Fire Roasted Yellow Pepper Salsa to enjoy for my chip-dipping pleasure. Unfortunately, I was unable to finish the whole jar by myself. I had a foodie-inspiration, since I loved the salsa so much and wanted to make sure to finish it, but was all out of tortilla chips. I decided to use it as a topping/marinade for my baked chicken dinner. It was super simple and delicious and I was able to finish the rest of the jar. The salsa certainly hit the spot, both to my tastebuds and to my non-wasteful satisfaction. The most unique feature of this salsa is that there are NO TOMATOES! It's made with whole yellow peppers, sunflower oil, salt, vinegar, spices, garlic powder, garlic, potato starch and citric acid. AND THAT'S IT! Serving Size: 1 Prep Time: 5 minutes Cook Time: 15-20 minutes Ingredients:
  • Chicken breast
  • Cucina & Amore Fire Roasted Yellow Pepper Salsa[gallery ids="375,376" type="rectangular"]  
Directions:
  1. Preheat the oven to 375°
  2. Bake the chicken breast on one side for 8 minutes (depending on the thickness of the chicken breast, it could be longer)
  3. Flip the chicken breast over, add the Cucina & Amore Fire Roasted Yellow Pepper salsa on top (add as much or as little as you like)
  4. Bake the chicken breast for another 8 minutes
  5. Enjoy!
Suggestions:
  • Enjoy with a side of rice or quinoa and your favorite veggies
  • Try it with some mixed greens, the salsa can be the dressing
  • Experiment with other meats like fish or shrimp

A Kitchen of Love from our Family to Yours!

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Looks so amazing

item.title: It's Better with Biscotti
item.dc:creator: cucinaandamore
item.content:encoded:
With all the great choices we have for breakfast nowadays, one thing that can never be beat is the simplicity of a simple coffee and a cookie. Not just any cookie though. This is something that travels all the way back to Ancient Roman times in Italy. It has left it's mark on the world to stand the test of time while evolving into more than any Roman's tastebuds could ever dream. It is the biscotti! Cucina & Amore offers every biscotti lover 4 delectable choices:
  1. Almond
  2. Chocolate
  3. Pistachio
  4. Cranberry Almond
  5. And a bonus Marzipan Cookie!
These tiny yet tasteful biscotti can be enjoyed with a cup of coffee, tea, or glass of wine any time of the day. Another appetizing element is that the biscotti makes a better option than a heavy slice of cake or overly sugared pastry option. So next time you have yourself a cup of coffee, trust me, it's better with biscotti!

A Kitchen of Love from our Family to Yours!

item.title: Pesto Crescent Rolls
item.dc:creator: cucinaandamore
item.content:encoded:
For those of you that love pesto and bread then this is the perfect recipe for you! It's super simple and only requires 2 base ingredients and then you can leave it to your own creative heart's desire to take it to the next level. Serving size: 4-8 (makes 8 rolls, but 4 people could have 2 rolls) Prep Time: 5-10 minutes Cook Time: 12 minutes Ingredients:
  • Cucina & Amore Pesto Alla Genovese 
  • Pillsbury Crescent Rolls
  • Shredded cheese
[gallery ids="490,491" type="rectangular"] Instructions:
  1. Preheat oven to 375°
  2. Roll out the crescent rolls onto a cutting board
  3. Spread as much pesto as you like on the sheet of crescent rolls 
  4. Add the filling of your choice (I added parmesan & Romano cheese)
  5. Roll into crescent rolls and place onto a baking sheet
  6. Bake for 12 minutes
  7. ENJOY!
Suggestions:
  • Fill with chicken or another meat that goes with pesto
  • Try another Cucina & Amore pesto or spread
    • Artichoke Pesto
    • Basil Pesto Truffle Sauce
    • Piquillo Pepper & Artichoke Bruschetta
  • Add other types of cheese like mozzarella

A Kitchen of Love from our Family to Yours!

item.title: Artichoke Pesto Zoodles
item.dc:creator: cucinaandamore
item.content:encoded:
Have you ever come across certain foods that just taste better in different shapes? In my experience, zucchini tastes a lot better in noodle form. Zucchini + Noodles = Zoodles. First and foremost, nothing will ever replace the satisfying taste of real spaghetti. But for those of us trying to eat healthier, a great alternative option, especially when you're craving that noodle shape, is zoodles! This recipe is perfect for those that are craving those noodles but want to keep their carb consumption in check. Zoodles are the perfect option for you! This Artichoke Pesto is perfect for Artichoke lovers. You can even see real pieces of artichoke in the sauce! I love the simple ingredients that you can actually pronounce and know what they are: Artichoke, sunflower oil, salt, garlic, vinegar, spices, citric acid, and ascorbic acid. It's the perfect pesto for people who are gluten free and vegan! Serving size: 1 Prep Time: 5 minutes Cook Time: 30 minutes Ingredients:
  1. Zucchini
  2. Cucina & Amore Pesto alla Firenze Artichoke
Directions:
  1. Preheat your oven to 200°
  2. Use a spiralizer to make the zucchini noodles (I bought mine for $15 at Bed, Bath, and Beyond)[gallery ids="573,579" type="columns"]
  3. Line a baking sheet with 2 layers of paper towels and arrange the zoodles in an even layer
  4. Bake the zoodles for 30 minutes
  5. Take the noodles out of the oven, wrap the zoodles with the paper towels and wring out the excess water left within the zoodles (keep squeezing because there's surprisingly a lot of water in this veggie)
  6. Take the remaining zoodles and add Cucina & Amore Pesto alla Firenze Artichoke (add as much or as little as you like)
  7. Enjoy!
Suggestions:
  • Add chicken or shrimp
  • Try zoodles with other Cucina & Amore products
    • Basil Pesto Truffle Sauce
    • Sun-dried Tomato Pesto
    • Basilico Pasta Sauce
  • Experiment by adding
    • Piquillo Peppers
    • Grilled Artichokes
    • Sun-dried Tomatoes

A Kitchen of Love from our Family to Yours!

item.title: Artichoke Pasta Overload
item.dc:creator: cucinaandamore
item.content:encoded:
This recipe is for all the artichoke lovers out there. It is definitely a Spring vegetable that is  a delicious addition to any pasta dish. Why wait until Spring for a taste of these savory greens? This is a simple recipe that only requires 4 ingredients which you can also play around with. It's time for the artichoke to get the respect it deserves in which your tastebuds can enjoy! Serving Size: 4-8 (depends on how hungry you are)  Prep Time: 10-15 minutes Cook Time: 10 minutes Ingredients:
  • Cucina & Amore Organic Bronze-Cut Penne Rigate 
  • Cucina & Amore Pesto alla Firenze Artichoke
  • Cucina & Amore Artichoke Hearts Grilled & Marinated
  • Cucina & Amore Sun-dried Tomatoes  [gallery ids="633,634,562" type="columns"]
Directions:
  1. Cook pasta following the directions on the box
  2. Drain pasta and put in a large bowl
  3. Mix the Artichoke Pesto with the pasta (add as much pesto as you want)
  4. Chop some sun-dried tomatoes and add it to the pasta
  5. Top off your pasta dish with some grilled & marinated artichoke hearts
  6. Enjoy!
Suggestions:
  • Add chicken or shrimp
  • Eat it cold. It can be a great pasta salad too!
  • You can always add more artichokes

A Kitchen of Love from our Family to Yours!

item.title: Pesto Truffle Pasta
item.dc:creator: cucinaandamore
item.content:encoded:
Sometimes the simplest of meals can be made even more delicious by the quality of the ingredients that you use. That's why this super simple recipe ranks at the top of the quality food chain with the help of Cucina & Amore's Basil Pesto Truffle Sauce. As soon as you open the jar, the aroma of truffles fills the air and you can't wait for that pasta to be cooked to start enjoying each and every bite. The addition of the truffle takes the traditional pesto to a whole other gourmet level! It's easy to make and even easier to enjoy. Serving size: 4-8 Prep Time: 10 minutes Cooking Time: 12 minutes Ingredients:
  • 1/2 package Cucina & Amore Organic Bronze-Cut Penne Rigate
  • 1 jar Cucina & Amore Basil Pesto Truffle Sauce
Directions:
  1. Make pasta according to directions on the box
  2. Add as much Basil Pesto Truffle Sauce as you like
  3. Enjoy!
Suggestions:
  • Add pine nuts or top with parmesan cheese
  • Try some of Cucina & Amore's other truffle sauces:
    • Artichoke Truffle Sauce
    • Sun-dried Tomato Truffle Sauce
  • Experiment by adding some chicken or shrimp

A Kitchen full of Love from our Family to Yours!

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Looks amazing

item.title: Teriyaki Chicken with Mango & Jalapeño Quinoa
item.dc:creator: cucinaandamore
item.content:encoded:
Sometimes a recipe just comes to your mind and your instant reaction is "why didn't I think of that before?" This recipe is just that. I made myself teriyaki chicken and was wondering what I should eat with it and the thought just came to me. The best part about the Cucina & Amore Quinoa Meal is that the sauce completes the meal. It has everything that you need that doesn't require hours in the kitchen trying to prepare, but definitely provides all the flavor and nutrition. The simplicity of this recipe is that you only technically needs 2 ingredients: teriyaki chicken and the Mango & Jalapeño Quinoa Meal. The teriyaki and mango blend together to provide the perfect amount of sweetness with a subtle bite of jalapeño heat. I hope to have more of those "A-ha!" moments again because this one was one great idea that I'm happy to share. Serving Size: 1-2 Prep Time: 5-10 minutes Cook Time: 15-20 minutes Ingredients:
  • Teriyaki Chicken
  • Cucina & Amore Mango & Jalapeño Quinoa Meal
Directions:
  1. 2 options for teriyaki chicken
    1. Buy pre-made teriyaki chicken
    2. Marinade your own at home (which is what I did)
  2. Preheat the oven to 400°
  3. Bake the marinated chicken breast for 8-10 minutes (depending on the thickness)
  4. Flip the chicken breast over and bake for another 8-10 minutes
    • You could also grill or sauté the chicken breast for faster cooking
  5. Take the chicken breast out of the oven and cut into thin slices
  6. Unwrap the Quinoa Meal
  7. Mix the Mango & Jalapeño sauce with the pre-cooked quinoa
    • Add as much sauce as you like
  8. Either serve the teriyaki chicken and quinoa meal separately or mix it altogether in one bowl
  9. Enjoy
Suggestions:
  • Try using Cucina & Amore Spicy Jalapeño Quinoa Meal
  • Add shrimp instead of chicken
  • Experiment with some greens by adding some spinach or broccoli

A Kitchen full of Love from our Family to Yours!

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Looks so good

item.title: The Secret Ingredient Salsa
item.dc:creator: cucinaandamore
item.content:encoded:
Sometimes you see something and you think you've seen it all. Especially when it comes to something as common as salsa. But have you ever come across a salsa made without it's most famous ingredient? Cucina & Amore has 3 different salsas that have no tomatoes.....I repeat....NO TOMATOES! And a 4th salsa that has a sweet blend of tomatoes, piquillo peppers, and passion fruit. It's amazing the subtle shift from one ingredient to another can make the most delicious difference. And as always, these salsas are gluten free.

Fire Roasted Yellow Pepper Salsa

The Savory Salsa

This salsa's main ingredient is, you guessed it, whole yellow peppers which create a nice savory flavor with a hint of heat at the end of each bite.

[gallery ids="851,375" type="rectangular"]

Fire Roasted Red Pepper Salsa

The Spicy Salsa

This salsa is Hot! Hot! Hot! If you like a spicy heat in your salsa then this blend of red pepper, red hot chili pepper, and jalapeño peppers are the perfect match for you.

[gallery ids="852,814" type="square" columns="2"]

Piquillo Pepper & Mango Salsa

The Sweet & Spicy Salsa

Don't let the mango fool you. This salsa has a nice sweet start with a kick of spice to finish it off. The blend of piquillo pepper, mango, and jalapeño peppers are the perfect combination of sweet & spicy

[gallery ids="854,823" type="square" columns="2"]

Piquillo Pepper & Passion Fruit Salsa

The Exotic Salsa

An exotic spin on the classic salsa recipe. This unique mix of tomato, green piquillo pepper and passion fruit take your tastebuds on a tropical island getaway everyone is sure to enjoy

[gallery ids="853,826" type="square" columns="2"] The best part about these salsas are that they can be used for so much more than just for your chip dipping pleasure.
  • Use as a topping for chicken, fish, or steak
  • Try sautéing with your favorite vegetables
  • Add some kick to your carbs like rice or quinoa

A Kitchen full of Love from our Family to Yours!

item.title: Spinach, Kale & Artichoke Salad
item.dc:creator: cucinaandamore
item.content:encoded:
Most of the times, simpler is just better. You don't have to add a ton of ingredients to a salad to make it flavorful, delicious and satisfying. I think sometimes, simplicity is key, especially when you don't have time to chop all the fixings for a salad. This Spinach, Kale, and Artichoke salad is just that...spinach, kale, and artichoke. What brings it altogether is the dressing. In this case, there are actually 2 dressings, Cucina & Amore Fruttato Extra Virgin Olive Oil and Balsamic Vinegar of Modena that come together for an appetizing salad that everyone is sure to enjoy. Ingredients:
  • Spinach
  • Kale
    • I bought a prepackaged combination of spinach & kale from the store
  • Cucina & Amore Artichoke Hearts Grilled & Marinated
  • Cucina & Amore Fruttato Extra Virgin Olive Oil
  • Cucina & Amore Balsamic Vinegar of Modena
[gallery ids="878,633,879" type="columns"] Directions:
  1. Mix the spinach and kale in a big bowl
  2. Open the jar of artichoke hearts
  3. Take off the leaves of the artichoke hearts and add them to the salad
    • Add as much as you'd like
  4. Toss the salad with the Fruttato Extra Virgin Olive Oil
    • Make sure it coats the entire salad evenly
  5. Drizzle the Balsamic Vinegar on top of the blended salad
  6. Enjoy!
Suggestions:
  • Try adding some protein like chicken or steak
  • Mix with Cucina & Amore Robusto Extra Virgin Olive Oil 
    • Full of flavor, well-balanced, with a spicy finish
  • Add some other toppings like tomatoes or cheese

A Kitchen Full of Love from our Family to Yours!

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Mmm looks so yummy

item.title: Mango & Jalapeno Quinoa Salad
item.dc:creator: cucinaandamore
item.content:encoded:
One of the best moments that I have come to enjoy is when people share their love for Cucina & Amore. Many express their love in different ways, but the one I like the most is sharing their meal/recipe ideas with us. It fills my heart with joy and my tummy wanting more Cucina & Amore. This recipe came from one of our fans, Amy C., who shared her recipe on our Facebook page. This recipe is great because it's super simple and so delicious all at the same time. Thank you Amy! I hope to get more love for the Kitchen of Love with some more fan favorite recipes. Serving Size: 1-2 Prep Time: 5 minutes Cook Time: None   Ingredients:
  • Spinach
  • Kale
    • I bought a mixed package of both at the store
  • Cucina & Amore Mango & Jalapeño Pepper Quinoa Meal
Directions:
  1. Mix the spinach and kale together
    • Or you can just choose your favorite greens
  2. Unwrap the Mango & Jalapeño Quinoa Meal
  3. Mix the Mango & Jalapeño sauce with the already cooked quinoa
    • You can add as much sauce as you like
  4. Add the mixed Mango & Jalapeño Quinoa to the mixed spinach and kale
  5. Toss the ingredients together until evenly coated
    • The Mango & Jalapeño sauce acts as a dressing
  6. Enjoy
Suggestions:
  • Add some chicken for some extra protein
  • Try using Cucina & Amore Artichoke & Roasted Pepper Quinoa Meal
  • Experiment with some other greens like avocado

A Kitchen Full of Love from our Family to Yours!

item.title: The Better Bruschetta
item.dc:creator: cucinaandamore
item.content:encoded:
Bruschetta is a typical Italian appetizer which is most commonly served as chopped tomatoes. But what if I told you bruschetta didn't have to be tomatoes at all? Variety is the spice of life, right? Why not change up that old boring bruschetta and try something different? Cucina & Amore has 5 different bruschetta to choose from that will be sure to be a hit at your next party or get together.

Go gourmet with Cucina & Amore Bruschetta! And all of them are gluten free.

 Piquillo & Jalapeño Bruschetta

Spice it Up

This bruschetta is nice and spicy. For anyone looking for a bit of heat in every bite, this is the bruschetta for you.

[gallery ids="986,993" type="rectangular"]

Sun-Dried Tomato Bruschetta

A Salty Bite

This bruschetta is experiments with sun-dried tomatoes which create a nice salty and savory spread.

[gallery ids="988,1005" type="rectangular"]

Artichoke Bruschetta

Awesomely Artichoke

This bruschetta is calling out to all the artichoke lovers. It's main ingredient is finely chopped artichokes that can help satisfy any artichoke craving.

[gallery ids="990,1015" type="rectangular"]

Piquillo & Artichoke Bruschetta

Surprisingly Sweet

When people see a pepper on the label, they automatically think it's going to be hot. This bruschetta is surprisingly somewhat sweet. The combination of piquillo pepper and artichoke are perfect. It's no wonder why it's a fan favorite!

[gallery ids="985,1023" type="rectangular"]

Olive Medley Bruschetta

All about the Olives

This bruschetta is made of both green olives AND black olives. If you love olives then this is the bruschetta for you! It's a bold olive taste that you're sure to enjoy.

[gallery ids="987,1022" type="rectangular"] Suggestions:
  • Use it as a spread on your next sandwich or wrap
  • Try it as a topping on chicken, fish, or eggplant
  • Add it to your vegetables or pasta

A Kitchen of Love from our Family to Yours!

item.title: Pesto Garlic Bread
item.dc:creator: cucinaandamore
item.content:encoded:
Bread is one carb that I'll never give up. So when I found myself with a lot of bread at home, I had to figure out what I could make with it. This was another one of my "A-ha!" moments. I was so happy that I was able to find a way to incorporate pesto into yet another recipe. Pesto goes with pretty much everything and especially with garlic bread. With a few simple steps, I was able to create a quick and easy Pesto Garlic Bread. It's perfect as an appetizer, a snack, or even the bread for a nice sandwich. Serving Size: 2-4 Prep Time: 10-15 minutes Cook Time: 10-15 minutes Ingredients:
  • 1 Baguette
  • 3 TBLS Cucina & Amore Basil Pesto Alla Genovese
  • 1 Cup shredded Parmesan & Romano Cheese
  • 1 TSP Garlic
  • 2 TBLS Cucina & Amore Fruttato Extra Virgin Olive Oil[gallery ids="491,879" type="columns"]
Directions:
  1. Preheat oven to 400° F and line a baking sheet with aluminum foil
  2. Cut the baguette in half then cut the halves length wise
  3. Crush the garlic
    • I used about 1 tsp, but you can use more if you like a lot of garlic
  4. Mix the Cucina & Amore Fruttato EVOO with the garlic
  5. Drizzle the baguette with the olive oil and garlic mixture
  6. In a bowl, mix a cup of Parmesan & Romano cheese
    • Mine came in a mixed bag
    • You can also use mozzarella or Italian cheese blend
  7. Add the pesto to the cheese and stir until all the cheese is evenly coated in pesto
  8. Spread the pesto cheese mixture evenly onto each baguette
  9. Put the baguette on the baking sheet and put it in the oven
  10. Cook for 10-15 minutes (depending on the oven and if you like it crispy)
  11. Enjoy!
Suggestions:
  • Add some chicken or artichoke
  • Try with mozzarella cheese
  • Top off with some tomatoes

A Kitchen of Love from our Family to Yours!

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: […] via Pesto Garlic Bread — cucinaandamore […]

item.title: Turkey Artichoke Pesto Sandwich
item.dc:creator: cucinaandamore
item.content:encoded:
The best part about a sandwich is your ability to customize it any way you want. Even by adding one simple ingredient to the traditional sandwich can make a world of difference. This Turkey Artichoke Pesto Sandwich recipe is the perfect afternoon pick me up. It will satisfy those sandwich craving tastebuds and leave you with a feeling of, damn that was good! At least that was my reaction when I made it. Serving Size: 1 or 2 Prep Time: 10-12 minutes Cook Time: 0-5 minutes Ingredients:
  • Bread roll (I used a telera roll from Whole Foods)
  • Turkey breast
  • Tomato
  • Spinach
  • Provolone Cheese
  • Cucina & Amore Artichoke Pesto Alla Firenze
  • Cucina & Amore Artichoke Hearts Grilled & Marinated[gallery ids="562,633" type="rectangular"]
Directions:
  1. Cut the roll in half
    • You could also try using focaccia bread 
  2. Spread each slice of bread with the Artichoke Pesto
  3. Add a slice of provolone cheese to one or both slices of bread
    • If you're like me, you can toast/melt your cheese in a toaster oven
  4. Slice the tomato and add it to the sandwich
  5. Add a few slices of turkey
  6. Put on some spinach leaves
  7. Top it off with some Artichoke Hearts
    • Take the leaves of the artichoke and add it on top of the spinach (add as much as you like)
  8. Cut the sandwich in half
  9. Enjoy!
Suggestions:
  • Substitute with chicken or eggplant
  • Try using focaccia bread
  • Use Cucina & Amore's Basil Pesto Alla Genovese

A Kitchen of Love from our Family to Yours!

item.title: Yin & Yang Quinoa
item.dc:creator: cucinaandamore
item.content:encoded:
Let's face it, Quinoa is delicious! You can do a lot of different things with this superfood. You could have it for breakfast, lunch, dinner, AND dessert! It's amazing how versatile quinoa can be with the ingredients that you choose to cook or bake with it. A perfect example is my Yin & Yang Quinoa recipe. Both sides are made with the same core ingredients, but there is only 1 change that makes all the difference. Serving: 8-10 Prep Time: 5-10 minutes Cook Time: 15-20 minutes Ingredients:
  • Quinoa
  • Brown rice (optional)
  • Jennie O's Italian Seasoned Ground Turkey
  • Cucina & Amore Fire Roasted Yellow Pepper Salsa
  • Cucina & Amore Fire Roasted Red Pepper Salsa[gallery ids="375,376,814" type="columns"]
Directions:
  1. Cook the entire package of Italian Seasoned Ground Turkey on a skillet until all of the meat is fully cooked and browned
    • You don't need to grease the pan because the juices from the ground turkey should be enough
  2. Drain the ground turkey then put it back on the skillet
  3. Take the cooked quinoa and brown rice and mix it together
    • You can use already cooked quinoa and brown rice
    • I used a mixed bag of quinoa and brown rice pouch that required 90 seconds in the microwave to cook it (I used 2 pouches of mixed quinoa and brown rice)
  4. Add the mixture of cooked quinoa and brown rice to the ground turkey in the skillet
  5. On low heat, stir the quinoa, brown rice, and ground turkey until they are mixed thoroughly
  6. In 2 medium-sized bowls, separate the mixture equally
  7. In 1 bowl, add the Fire Roasted Yellow Pepper Salsa
    • Add as much as you'd like. I used enough to see the quinoa and brown rice turn a little yellow
    • The Fire Roasted Yellow Pepper Salsa is a savory salsa with it's main ingredient of yellow pepper. No tomatoes found in this salsa! 
  8. In the other bowl, add the Piquillo Pepper & Passion Fruit Salsa
    1. Add as much as you'd like. I used enough to see the quinoa and brown rice turn a little red
    2. The Piquillo Pepper & Passion Fruit Salsa creates a sweeter, tropical taste that blends surprisingly well with the Italian seasoning from the ground turkey
  9. Serve separately or together on one plate
  10. Enjoy!
Suggestions:
  • Try it with chicken, shrimp, or no meat at all
  • Use one of Cucina & Amore's other salsas
    • Piquillo Pepper & Mango for sweet and spicy
  • Add some avocado

A Kitchen of Love from our Family to Yours!

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Looks greatb

item.title: Stuffed Piquillo Peppers
item.dc:creator: cucinaandamore
item.content:encoded:
For those of you who have never tried a piquillo pepper, they are not spicy. When people see the word pepper, they immediately think that it's going to be hot. Piquillo peppers are similar to a bell pepper and can actually be kind of sweet. This simple recipe actually makes 2 different types of appetizers. One of which is a low carb version. These stuffed piquillo peppers can help set the tone of a party with a fancier more gourmet style rather than the regular chips and dip. Serving: 5-8 Prep Time: 10 minutes Cook Time: 0 Ingredients:
  • Cucina & Amore Piquillo Peppers
  • Cucina & Amore Piquillo & Artichoke Bruschetta
  • Cucina & Amore Spicy Jalapeño & Roasted Peppers Quinoa Meal[gallery ids="1189,985,780" type="square"]
Directions:
  1. Line a plate with paper towels
  2. Open the jar of Piquillo Peppers
  3. Carefully take out the piquillo peppers and lie them on the paper towel
  4. Pat them dry to soak up the excess oil
  5. Cut the piquillo pepper to make them bite size, but large enough that you can still stuff them
  6. Open the Piquillo & Artichoke Bruschetta and scoop as much bruschetta into the piquillo pepper without overstuffing it
  7. Open both packages within the Quinoa Meal
  8. Mix as much Jalapeño & Roasted Pepper sauce with the quinoa
    • You will not use all of the quinoa meal in this recipe
  9. Stuff the remaining piquillo peppers with the Jalapeño Quinoa Meal mixture
  10. Serve & Enjoy!
Suggestions:
  • Add chicken to the quinoa meal then stuff the piquillo pepper
  • Trying using other Cucina & Amore products
    • Artichoke Bruschetta
    • Artichoke & Roasted Peppers Quinoa Meal
    • Mango & Jalapeño Quinoa Meal
  • Experiment with different cheeses like feta or goat cheese

A Kitchen of Love from our Family to Yours!

item.title: Mediterranean Breakfast Sandwich
item.dc:creator: cucinaandamore
item.content:encoded:
Sometimes I have a sweet tooth that craves for sweet breakfast items like pancakes, french toast, and donuts. Other times I have a savory tooth that craves eggs, bacon, and vegetables. Today was a savory tooth kind of day. This Mediterranean Breakfast Sandwich recipe is actually quite simple and easy to make. Some people think that when there is more than 2 or 3 ingredients, it gets too complicated. I was able to make this sandwich and enjoy it within 10 minutes! Serving: 1-2 Prep Time: 5 minutes Cook Time: 5 minutes Ingredients:
  • 1 Bread roll (I used a Telera Roll from Whole Foods)
  • 1 egg
  • 1 diced Cucina & Amore Sun-dried tomato
  • Spinach
  • Kale
  • 1/2 tsp of feta cheese
  • 1 tsp of Cucina & Amore Piquillo & Artichoke Bruschetta
[gallery ids="985,634" type="rectangular"] Directions:
  1. Heat a small skillet or sauce pan to medium heat
  2. Take the bread roll and cut it in half
  3. Put the bread in a toaster oven to heat it up
  4. Line a plate with paper towels
  5. Open the jar of Sun-Dried Tomatoes
  6. Take out one medium-sized tomato and put it on the paper towel
  7. Pat the tomato with the paper towel to soak up the excess oil
  8. Dice the sun-dried tomato
  9. In a small bowl, scramble one egg
    • You can try adding a little milk to make the egg more fluffy
  10. Add the scrambled egg to the heated skillet or sauce pan
  11. Half way through cooking the egg, add the diced sun-dried tomato
  12. As the egg & tomato continue to cook, spread the Piquillo & Artichoke Bruschetta on one or both sides of the bread
  13. Once fully cooked, remove the egg and sun-dried tomato from the skillet
  14. Add the egg & sun-dried tomato to the bread
  15. Add the feta cheese
  16. Top with a few pieces of spinach and kale
    • I had a container that was mixed with both
    • You could just use one or the other
  17. Put the remaining slice of bread on top and cut the sandwich in half
  18. Enjoy! 
Suggestions:
  • Add bacon or sausage
  • Try with Cucina & Amore Sun-Dried Tomato Bruschetta
  • Add some avocado

A Kitchen of Love from our Family to Yours!

item.title: Mediterranean Flatbread
item.dc:creator: cucinaandamore
item.content:encoded:
Artichokes are an acquired taste. They also just happen to be a delicious topping to take the boring to extraordinary. You can add artichokes to salads, sandwiches, pastas, pizza and more! If you haven't seen any of my other posts, I love artichokes! Here is another recipe to satisfy all artichoke lovers. This Mediterranean Flatbread recipe is easy to make and gluten free! After experimenting with gluten free pizza crust for the first time, I have determined to call it a flatbread rather than a pizza, but I guess you could also call it a thin-crust pizza. Serving: 1-2 Prep Time: 10 minutes Cook Time: 10-12 minutes Ingredients:
  • Gluten free pizza crust (I used Rustic Crust)
  • Cucina & Amore Basil Pesto Alla Genovese
  • Go Veggie Mozzarella Cheese Alternative
  • Cucina & Amore Grilled & Marinated Artichoke Hearts
  • Cucina & Amore Sun-dried Tomato
[gallery ids="988,633,491" type="columns"] Directions:
  1. Preheat oven to 425°F
  2. Open the package of gluten free crust 
  3. Spread pesto evenly onto crust
  4. Add mozzarella cheese thoroughly
  5. Line a plate with paper towels.
  6. Remove the marinated artichokes from the jar and put onto the paper towel
  7. Use the paper towel to remove all excess oil from the marinated artichokes
  8. Place quartered artichokes onto the flatbread
  9. Line a plate with paper towels.
  10. Remove the sun-dried tomato from the jar and put onto the paper towel
  11. Use the paper towel to remove all excess oil from the sun-dried tomato
  12. Dice the sun-dried tomato
  13. Add diced sun-dried tomato to the flatbread
  14. Place the flatbread directly onto the middle oven rack
  15. Bake for 10-12 minutes
  16. Enjoy!
Suggestions:
  • Add chicken or proscuitto
  • Try using other Cucina & Amore sauces
    • Pesto Alla Firenze (Artichoke Pesto)
    • Pesto Alla Siciliana (Sun-dried Tomato)
    • Basil Pesto Truffle Sauce
  • Top with some feta cheese or use Italian cheese blend instead of mozzarella

A Kitchen of Love from our Family to Yours!

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Looks amazing

item.title: Cheesy Gourmet Baguettes
item.dc:creator: cucinaandamore
item.content:encoded:
Who doesn't love pizza? I know I do! This Cheesy Gourmet Baguettes recipe takes a spin on the traditional pizza to make it oh so gooey and gourmet. In this recipe, there are 2 Cheesy Gourmet Baguettes to choose from. One of them is vegan thanks to Go Veggie. Serving: 1-2 people Prep Time: 10-12 minutes Cook Time: 12-15 minute Ingredients: Vegan Option
  • Baguette
  • Go Veggie Vegan Mozzarella Cheese Alternative
  • Tomato
  • Cucina & Amore Artichoke Bruschetta
Non-Vegan Option
  • Baguette
  • Go Veggie Mozzarella Cheese Alternative
  • Cucina & Amore Sun-dried Tomato Bruschetta
Directions:
  1. Preheat oven to 400°F
  2. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or aluminum foil
  3. Cut the baguette in half
  4. Spread the bruschetta onto the baguette[gallery ids="1384,1389" type="columns"]
  5. Top with the Go Veggie Mozzarella[gallery ids="1385,1391" type="square" columns="2"]
  6. If you want, slice a tomato and put on top of the baguette
  7. Bake for 12-15 minutes
  8. Enjoy
Suggestions:
  • Add some chicken
  • Try using some other Cucina & Amore sauce or spread
    • Basil Truffle Pesto
    • Piquillo & Artichoke Bruschetta
    • Pesto Alla Firenze (Artichoke Pesto) 
  • Replace bread with eggplant or spaghetti squash

A Kitchen of Love from our Family to Yours!

item.title: Spicy Jalapeno Pizza
item.dc:creator: cucinaandamore
item.content:encoded:
Sometimes I go through a spicy phase when all I crave are spicy foods. Others just love the zing of heat that scorches their tongue and the beads of sweat that make your tastebuds come alive. I thought of this pizza creation for the people that love spice and would like some more of it. And the best part about this Spicy Jalapeño Pizza recipe is that it is completely GLUTEN FREE and VEGAN! Serving Size: 1-2 Prep Time: 10 minutes Cook Time: 12-15 minutes Ingredients:
  • Rustic Crust Gluten Free Pizza Crust
  • Go Veggie Mozzarella Cheese Alternative
  • Cucina & Amore Piquillo & Jalapeño Bruschetta
  • Cucina & Amore Sliced TriColor Jalapeños
[gallery ids="1447,986" type="columns"] Directions:
  1. Preheat oven to 425°F
  2. Put the pizza crust on a plate or cutting board
  3. Spread the Piquillo & Jalapeño Bruschetta evenly onto the pizza crust
  4. Add as much Go Veggie Mozzarella as you like
  5. Open the jar of TriColor Jalapeños and add as many as you like
  6. Place the pizza directly on to the middle oven rack
  7. Bake for 12-15 minutes (depending on the oven and your preference of a crispy crust)
  8. Enjoy!
Suggestions:
  • Add chicken, pepperoni, or spicy sausage
  • Use some of our other Cucina & Amore sauces
    • Sun-dried Tomato Bruschetta
    • Basil Truffle Pesto
    • Basilico Pasta Sauce
  • Try with a drizzle of Sriracha or hot sauce

A Kitchen of Love from our Family to Yours!

item.title: Protein Packed Breakfast Bowl
item.dc:creator: cucinaandamore
item.content:encoded:
Everyone knows that breakfast is the most important meal of the day. Why not start the day off right with a healthy meal full of healthy protein and carbs? This recipe is perfect for the vegetarian, gluten free foodie who wants a meal packed with a protein punch! Serving Size: 1-2 Prep Time: 2-3 minutes Cook Time: 5 minutes Ingredients:
  • Spinach
  • Kale
  • Egg
  • Cucina & Amore Spicy Jalapeño Quinoa Meal
Directions:
  1. Heat a skillet or sauce pan on medium heat
  2. Scramble the egg
  3. Add the scrambled egg to the pan
  4. Add as much spinach and kale as you like
    • You can choose either one. I had a mixed container of both
  5. Open both containers in the quinoa meal
  6. In a medium-sized bowl, place the quinoa then add as much Jalapeño mix as you like
    • Make sure the sauce is thoroughly mixed in with the quinoa
  7. Add the scrambled egg, spinach, and kale to the Jalapeño Quinoa mix
  8. Stir all the ingredients together
  9. If you like your quinoa heated, pop the bowl in the microwave for 30 seconds
  10. Enjoy
Suggestions:
  • Add some turkey bacon or sausage
  • Try using other Cucina & Amore Quinoa Meals
    • Artichoke & Roasted Pepper
    • Mango & Jalapeño
  • Use egg whites for a healthier option
  • Add cheese or avocado

A Kitchen of Love from our Family to Yours!

item.title: Caprese Quinoa Salad
item.dc:creator: cucinaandamore
item.content:encoded:
Have you ever had a good meal, but just by adding a few more ingredients you turned it into a great meal? This is what happened when I thought, "what could make this Pesto Quinoa Meal even more delicious?" Turn it into a Caprese Quinoa Salad. This Caprese Quinoa Salad is perfect for a lunch time meal or to bring to your next summer get together. It is a yummy alternative to the traditional pesto pasta salad and probably a whole lot healthier too. Making this meal is super fast because the quinoa is already cooked! Serving Size: 1-2 Prep Time: 5 minutes Cook Time: 2-3 minutes Ingredients:
  • Cucina & Amore Basil Pesto Quinoa Meal
  • 1/2 cup Cherry Tomatoes - halved
  • 1/2 cup Mozzarella
Directions:
  1. Open quinoa cup from the Pesto Quinoa Meal
  2. Place the quinoa in a medium-sized bowl
  3. Chop the cherry tomatoes in half
  4. Cut 1/2 cup of mozzarella into small bite-sized pieces
  5. Place the tomatoes and mozzarella in the bowl with the quinoa
  6. Open the pesto cup from the Pesto Quinoa Meal
  7. Add as much pesto as you like to the quinoa, tomato, and mozzarella bowl
  8. Stir until the pesto is mixed evenly
  9. Enjoy!
Suggestions:
  • Add chicken or shrimp
  • Try using another Cucina & Amore Quinoa Meal
    • Artichoke & Roasted Peppers
    • Spicy Jalapeño
  • Use feta cheese instead of mozzarella

A Kitchen of Love from our Family to Yours!

item.title: Turkey Arrabbiata Spaghetti
item.dc:creator: cucinaandamore
item.content:encoded:
I love it when a traditional meal can be taken to the next level of deliciousness by just using the right product and ingredients. I love Italian food and what dish is more Italian than spaghetti? This Turkey Arrabbiata Spaghetti recipe is a slightly healthier version than the original with the help of a few select ingredients. Believe it or not, this recipe only calls for 3 ingredients Serving size: 4-6 Prep Time:10-15 minutes Cook Time: 10-15 minutes Ingredients:
  • 1 package of Cucina & Amore Organic Bronze-Cut Spaghetti
  • 1 jar of Cucina & Amore Arrabbiata Pasta Sauce
  • 1lb package of Jennie O's Italian Seasoned Ground Turkey
Directions:
  1. Boil water according to the directions on spaghetti package
  2. Cook spaghetti in boiling water
  3. In a saucepan, cook the Italian Seasoned Ground Turkey until it is browned
  4. Drain the turkey to get rid of the excess grease and then put it back in the saucepan
  5. Add the Arrabbiata pasta sauce
  6. Stir on a low heat until the spaghetti is finished cooking
  7. Drain the spaghetti
  8. Top the spaghetti with the Turkey Arrabbiata sauce
  9. Enjoy!
Suggestions:
  • Use ground spicy sausage or slices of Italian sausage
  • Try another Cucina & Amore pasta sauce
    • Basilico
    • Formaggio
    • Puttanesca
  • Use other pastas like farfalle or penne rigate

A Kitchen of Love from our Family to Yours!
