item.title: Italian Quesadilla
item.dc:creator: cucinaandamore
item.content:encoded:
There are sometimes when you just can't decide what you want to make. With so many cuisine choices nowadays, it can be hard to narrow it down to just one. Why choose just one? This Italian Quesadilla recipe brings together the deliciousness of both Italian and Mexican foods and it is awesome! A delightful surprise to satisfy your hunger. Serving: 1-2 Prep Time: 5 minutes Cook Time: 5 minutes Ingredients:
  • 2 Tortillas (I used Mission Gluten Free Tortillas)
  • Italian Cheese Blend
  • Cucina & Amore Piquillo & Artichoke Bruschetta
Directions:
  1. Evenly spread the Piquillo & Artichoke Bruschetta on a tortilla
2. Sprinkle with Italian cheese blend (as much or as little as you want) 3. Top with another tortilla 4. On a preheated skillet, toast the quesadilla for about 5-7 minutes (flipping occasionally) 5. Move the toasted quesadilla to a plate and slice the quesadilla 6. Enjoy! Suggestions:
  • Add chicken or beef
  • Try using other Cucina & Amore products
    • Piquillo & Jalapeño Bruschetta
    • Sun-dried Tomato Bruschetta
  • Add avocado or sun-dried tomatoes

A Kitchen of Love from our Family to Yours!

item.title: Artichoke Pesto Shrimp Pasta
item.dc:creator: cucinaandamore
item.content:encoded:
This pasta is perfect for shrimp lovers. It's simple, easy, and oh so delicious. You only need 3 ingredients for this recipe which makes it the perfect go to when coming home after a long day. It's filling and feeds the whole family. The Artichoke Pesto sauce is both gluten free and vegan and the perfect complement to the savory shrimp. Serving: 4-6 Prep Time: 10-15 minutes Cook Time: 10-15 minutes Ingredients:
  • 1 package Cucina & Amore Organic Bronze-Cut Farfalle
  • 2lbs Frozen Shrimp (would work best with fresh shrimp)
  • Cucina & Amore Pesto alla Firenze (Artichoke)
Directions:
  1. Boil pasta according to package
  2. Cook the entire page of frozen shrimp
    • Make sure there are no tails and deveined 
  3. Drain the pasta and put in a large bowl
  4. Add the cooked shrimp to the pasta
  5. Mix the shrimp pasta with the Artichoke Pesto
  6. Enjoy!
Suggestions:
  • Use chicken instead of shrimp
  • Try with other Cucina & Amore sauces
    • Pesto alla Siciliana 
    • Artichoke Truffle Sauce
    • Sun-dried Tomato Truffle Sauce
  • Add vegetables like sun-dried tomato or broccoli

A Kitchen of Love from our Family to Yours!

item.title: Spicy Quinoa Balls
item.dc:creator: cucinaandamore
item.content:encoded:
If you like spicy, this is the perfect gluten-free, meatless ball you will ever eat. It is a versatile meal that can be enjoyed all by itself, in a pita or on top of some spaghetti. Carbs on carbs is always an option. This recipe has more ingredients than I usually use to make a recipe but the result is oh so satisfying and delicious. Serving: 3-6 Prep Time: 10-15 minutes Cook Time: 30 minutes Ingredients:
  • Cucina & Amore Spicy Jalapeño Quinoa Meal
  • 3/4 cup Italian Cheese Blend
  • 2 sun-dried tomatoes, diced
  • 2 egg whites
  • 3 tbs coconut flour
  • 1/2 tsp salt
  • 1/2 tsp pepper
  • 1/2 tsp garlic powder
Directions:
  1. Preheat oven to 400°F
  2. Open the quinoa cup from the Quinoa Meal and pour it into a large bowl
  3. Mix the coconut flour, salt, pepper, and garlic powder together
  4. Add the dry mixture to the quinoa and stir
  5. Add the Italian cheese blend, 2 diced sun-dried tomatoes, and 2 egg whites
  6. Stir everything together
  7. Line a baking sheet with foil or parchment paper
    • Just make sure it's non-stick
  8. With your hands, form 6 quinoa balls
  9. Bake for 30 minutes or until golden brown
  10. Place the cooked quinoa balls on a plate and top with the Spicy Jalapeño sauce from the Quinoa Meal
  11. Enjoy!
Suggestions:
  • Use a different cheese like feta or mozzarella
  • Try a different Cucina & Amore Quinoa Meal
    • Artichoke & Roasted Pepper
    • Mango & Jalapeno
    • Basil Pesto 
  • Add some spinach or kale

A Kitchen of Love from our Family to Yours!

item.title: Chicken & Artichoke Quinoa
item.dc:creator: cucinaandamore
item.content:encoded:
Cucina & Amore likes helping people live healthier lives by making it easy to eat right and stay on track. Our quinoa meals are a great on-the-go meal when you don't have time to make your lunch or to help you avoid those fast food lines. The best part is that when you do have time to cook, this quinoa meal still comes in handy. All you have to do is add some meat or vegetables and you've got yourself another healthy, simple, delicious meal. This Chicken & Artichoke Quinoa recipe is simple with only 2 ingredients required and is perfect for those that meal prep, especially since the quinoa is already cooked! Take the time out of meal prepping and let Cucina & Amore help you. Serving Size: 1-2 Prep Time: 1-2 minutes Cook Time: 8-10 minutes Ingredients:
  • 1lb ground Chicken Breast
  • Cucina & Amore Artichoke & Roasted Peppers Quinoa Meal
Directions:
  1. Heat up a saucepan on medium heat
  2. Add about a tablespoon of olive oil to coat the pan
  3. Open the package of ground chicken breast
  4. Cook the chicken breast until fully cooked
  5. Open the Artichoke & Roasted Peppers sauce from the Quinoa Meal
  6. Add the Artichoke & Roasted Peppers sauce to the cooked chicken
  7. Stir on low heat
  8. Open the quinoa cup from the Quinoa Meal and place it in a medium sized bowl
  9. Top the quinoa with the Chicken and Artichoke & Roasted Peppers mixture
  10. Enjoy!
Suggestions:
  • Try ground turkey or eggplant instead of chicken
  • Use a different Cucina & Amore Quinoa Meal flavor
    • Basil Pesto
    • Spicy Jalapeño
    • Mango & Jalapeño
  • Top it off with some feta cheese

A Kitchen of Love from our Family to Yours!

item.title: Stuffed Bell Peppers
item.dc:creator: cucinaandamore
item.content:encoded:
Sometimes all you need to make a meal even more delicious is to just add more colorful food. The perfect example is a bell pepper. Each color has a slightly different flavor which makes them a deliciously healthy addition to any meal. These Stuffed Bell Peppers are filled with only 3 ingredients and it's super easy to make any day at any time. Serving: 2-4 Prep Time: 5 minutes Cook Time: 5-10 minutes Ingredients:
  • 4 bell peppers (any color)
  • Ground chicken breast
  • Cucina & Amore Artichoke & Roasted Peppers Quinoa Meal
Directions:
  1. Preheat a saucepan on medium heat
  2. Add about a tablespoon of olive oil to the pan
  3. Open the package of ground chicken breast
  4. Cook the ground chicken until fully cooked
  5. While the chicken is cooking, cut the bell peppers in half and hollow out the inside
  6. Open the quinoa meal
  7. In a medium-sized bowl, combine the artichoke & roasted peppers sauce with the quinoa
  8. Mix the fully cooked chicken with the artichoke & roasted peppers quinoa and stir
  9. Add the mixture of chicken & quinoa to the bell peppers
  10. Enjoy!
Suggestions:
  • Use ground beef or ground sausage
  • Try another Cucina & Amore Quinoa Meal
    • Basil Pesto
    • Mango & Jalapeño
    • Spicy Jalapeño
  • Add some avocado or other vegetables

A Kitchen of Love from our Family to Yours!

item.title: Piquillo & Artichoke Zoodles
item.dc:creator: cucinaandamore
item.content:encoded:
Simplicity is key when it comes to this recipe. It only takes 2 ingredients to help satisfy your hunger and make you feel really good about eating your vegetables too. This recipe is perfect for a hot summer day because the zoodles (zucchini noodles) are cold. No need to heat or bake or squeeze out any extra water. It's ready in minutes! Serving size: 1-2 Prep Time: 1-2 minutes Cook Time: 1-2 minutes Ingredients:
  • 1 medium sized zucchini
  • 2-3 TBS Cucina & Amore Piquillo & Artichoke Bruschetta
Directions:
  1. Peel the zucchini (optional step if you don't like the skin)
  2. Spiralize the zucchini
  3. Add the desired amount of Piquillo & Artichoke Bruschetta
  4. Mix well until all the zoodles are covered
  5. Enjoy!
Suggestions:
  • Add some more vegetables like spinach, kale, or tomato
  • Use another Cucina & Amore Bruschetta
    • Sun-dried Tomato
    • Artichoke
  • Try adding some cheese like feta or mozzarella

A Kitchen of Love from our Family to Yours!

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Lovely 😊

item.title: Tuna & Artichoke Quinoa
item.dc:creator: cucinaandamore
item.content:encoded:
Tuna is an easy source of protein that can be very practical. It's easy to open and just eat. And it tastes even better when mixed with our Artichoke & Roasted Peppers Quinoa Meal. This will definitely be the healthiest way you've ever enjoyed tuna. And it's ready to eat in just minutes! Serving Size: 1-2 Prep Time: 3-5 minutes Cook Time: 1-2 minutes Ingredients:
  • 1 can of tuna (I used Chicken of the Sea Light in water)
  • 1 Cucina & Amore Artichoke & Roasted Peppers Quinoa Meal
Directions:
  1. Open the quinoa meal
  2. Pour the quinoa into a medium sized bowl
  3. Add the Artichoke & Roasted Peppers sauce
  4. Open the tuna
  5. Drain the excess water
  6. Add the tuna to the Artichoke & Roasted Peppers Quinoa Meal
  7. Mix all ingredients together
  8. Enjoy!
Suggestions:
  • Use chicken or beef instead of tuna
  • Add some broccoli or other vegetables
  • Try another Cucina & Amore Quinoa Meal
    • Spicy Jalapeño
    • Mango & Jalapeño
    • Basil Pesto

A Kitchen of Love from our Family to Yours!

item.title: Summer Fancy Food Show Recap
item.dc:creator: cucinaandamore
item.content:encoded:
Just like that the 2016 Summer Fancy Food Show has come and gone. It was a 3 day extravaganza in which people from all over the world came to the Javits Center in New York City to experience and learn about all things related to the specialty food industry. The Specialty Food Association reported that it was the largest turnout they have ever had with "over 47,000 industry professionals, 2,670 exhibitors, and almost 400 first-time exhibitors." It was a sight to see and a memory to be made. This year at the Summer Fancy Food Show, you could find Cucina & Amore at Booth #1353. We were serving a smorgasbord of samples ranging from gnocchi & pasta sauce, pesto & truffle sauces, bruschettas, quinoa meals, artichoke hearts, and salsas. It was sure to satisfy any savory tooth in the entire convention center. [caption id="attachment_1951" align="alignnone" width="640"] Dean, Hossein, Abu[/caption] Cucina & Amore was able to display and present some of their new products including a variety of grains and beans such as lentils, farro, cannellini beans, polenta, arborio rice, and couscous. In addition, we have also added grapeseed oil, sliced tomatoes, and pizza sauce. Of course, it wouldn't be Cucina & Amore without our best selling item, our ready-to-eat Quinoa Meals! [caption id="attachment_1945" align="aligncenter" width="480"] Sandy & Dean[/caption] It was an eventful 3 days filled with walking, networking, and tons of food. One thing is for sure, the Kitchen of Love was excited to share their love for Cucina & Amore with a smile. [gallery ids="1948,1946,1950" type="rectangular"]

We had a great turnout at our booth this year at the Summer Fancy Food Show. We hope to keep sharing our love for delicious, healthy food with Cucina & Amore. Thank you all who came and hope to see you again next year!

A Kitchen of Love from our Family to Yours!

item.title: Pesto Garlic Monkeybread
item.dc:creator: cucinaandamore
item.content:encoded:
This recipe pretty much speaks for itself. It's a savory treat that's perfect for the whole family to enjoy. Super easy to eat and fun to make. With only 3 ingredients, you too can be noshing on some Pesto Garlic Monkeybread in no time! Serving Size: 4-6 Prep Time: 10-15 minutes Cook Time: 25 minutes Ingredients:
  • 1 can of Pillsbury Biscuits
  • 3 TBS Cucina & Amore Pesto alla Genovese (Basil Pesto)
  • 3 cloves crushed Garlic
Directions:
  1. Preheat oven to 375°F
  2. Open the can of biscuits
  3. Cut each biscuit into quarters
  4. Roll each quartered piece into a ball
  5. In a small bowl, mix the Basil Pesto and the crushed garlic
  6. Spray a bundt pan with some nonstick spray
  7. Place a few biscuit balls at the base of the pan
  8. Add a light layer of garlic pesto
    • You can also dip the biscuits in the pesto, but it will be messy!
  9. Repeat until all the biscuit balls and garlic pesto have been used
  10. Bake for 25 minutes
  11. Enjoy!
Suggestions:
  • Add some mozzarella cheese
  • Use other Cucina & Amore sauces
    • Basil Truffle Sauce
    • Artichoke Pesto
    • Pesto alla Siciliana (Sun-dried tomato)
  • Try adding shredded chicken

A Kitchen of Love from our Family to Yours!

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: droool!

item.title: Artichoke Truffle, Chicken, and Broccoli Pasta
item.dc:creator: cucinaandamore
item.content:encoded:
It only takes one ingredient to take your recipe to the next level. It's easy to head straight for the pesto, but why not kick it up a notch with an Artichoke Truffle sauce? It takes your meal from normal to gourmet in just a few scoops. Serving Size: 6-8 Prep time: 10-15 minutes Cook Time: 10-15 minutes Ingredients:
  • 1/2 package Cucina & Amore Organic Bronze-Cut Penne Rigate
  • 1 jar Cucina & Amore Artichoke Truffle Sauce
  • 1lb Foster Farm Boneless Skinless Chicken Breast (cubed)
  • 1 bag Green Giant Broccoli Florets
Directions:
  1. Cook the pasta according to the directions on the box
  2. Heat a sauce pan, add about a tablespoon of olive oil
  3. Sauté the 1lb of chicken
  4. Once fully cooked, drain the chicken and put back in the pan
  5. Add the bag of broccoli
  6. Add the Artichoke Truffle Sauce
  7. Stir until all the truffle sauce is mixed evenly
  8. Add the cooked pasta
  9. Stir until everything is mixed well
  10. Enjoy!
Suggestions:
  • Eat it without any pasta for a low carb meal
  • Try another Cucina & Amore sauce
    • Basil Pesto Truffle
    • Sun-dried Tomato Truffle
    • Artichoke Pesto
  • Add some mozzarella or parmesan

A Kitchen of Love from our Family to Yours!

item.title: Quinoa Breakfast Bites
item.dc:creator: cucinaandamore
item.content:encoded:
Quinoa for breakfast? Believe it or not, quinoa is great anytime of the day. Why not start your day off right with a superfood packed with protein and fiber to help you have a super day? This recipe is a savory and spicy breakfast treat that is a nice alternative to an omelet or the regular eggs and bacon. I used the Spicy Jalapeño sauce from the quinoa meal as a topping for the Quinoa Breakfast Bites like frosting on a cupcake. Just another way to enjoy the most important meal of the day! Serving Size: 1-2 Prep Time: 5-10 minutes Cook Time: 25 minutes Ingredients:
  • Cucina & Amore Spicy Jalapeño Quinoa Meal
  • 1/3 cup egg whites (2 eggs whites)
  • 1/3 cup chopped spinach
  • 1/2 cup shredded mozzarella cheese
  • 1 clove garlic (minced)
Directions:
  1. Preheat the oven to 375°F
  2. In a medium sized bowl, place the quinoa from the quinoa meal
  3. Heat the quinoa up for about 1 minute in the microwave
  4. Add the mozzarella while the quinoa is still hot and stir
    • Make sure the mozzarella is melted
  5. Add the spinach, egg whites, and garlic
  6. Stir until all the ingredients are combined
  7. Spray a muffin pan with non-stick spray
  8. Place the mixture into the muffin pan
  9. Bake for 25 minutes
  10. Place the quinoa breakfast bites on a plate
  11. Top off the bites with the Spicy Jalapeño sauce from the quinoa meal
  12. Enjoy!
Suggestions:
  • Add some ground breakfast sausage for added protein
  • Try using another Cucina & Amore Quinoa Meal
    • Basil Pesto
    • Artichoke & Roasted Peppers
    • Mango & Jalapeño
  • Use a different cheese like cheddar or broccoli instead of spinach

A Kitchen of Love from our Family to Yours!

item.title: Pesto Chicken Quinoa with Zoodles
item.dc:creator: cucinaandamore
item.content:encoded:
Have you ever experimented with food in your fridge? I bought a few items thinking, "oh yeah, I'll totally make this!" Then it never sounds good to eat when it's just sitting in your fridge waiting to serve the purpose of why you bought it in the first place. I had some extra ingredients and wanted to change up my Basil Pesto Quinoa Meal. This recipe is the perfect example of recipe experimentation and overall resourcefulness done right! Serving Size: 1-2 Prep Time: 5-8 minutes Cook Time: 5-10 minutes Ingredients:
  • Cucina & Amore Basil Pesto Quinoa Meal
  • 1 medium Zucchini (zoodles)
  • 1 grilled chicken breast (cubed)
Directions:
  1. Cut the chicken breast into cubes
  2. In a skillet, cook the chicken on medium heat until all of the pieces are cooked
  3. With a spiralizer, make the zucchini into zoodles (zucchini noodles)
  4. In a medium bowl, add the quinoa from the quinoa meal, the cooked chicken, and zoodles
  5. Top off with the Pesto from the quinoa meal
  6. Stir until all of the pesto is evenly mixed with the rest of the ingredients
  7. Enjoy!
Suggestions:
  • Use broccoli instead of zucchini
  • Try another Cucina & Amore Quinoa Meal
    • Artichoke & Roasted Peppers
    • Spicy Jalapeño
    • Mango & Jalapeño
  • Add some feta or mozzarella cheese

A Kitchen of Love from our Family to Yours!

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: This looks great!! We don't eat meat in my house but I'm going to try this with tomatoes instead of chicken.
I second this, it looks incredibly tasty!

item.title: 3 Easy Eats with Artichoke Bruschetta & Tuna
item.dc:creator: cucinaandamore
item.content:encoded:
I love options. Who doesn't? It's what keeps life interesting. When I decided to make this recipe, I was delighted to find several different ways of eating it and more importantly, enjoying it! There's so many things out there that can be used as an alternative option, but you would never think of it until someone gave you the option and opened your eyes to the world of endless foodie possibilities. This recipe is exactly that, which provides you with 3 different ways to enjoy our Artichoke Bruschetta & Tuna mix. Serving Size: 2-3 Prep Time: 2-3 minutes Cook Time: 2-3 minutes Ingredients:
  • 4 TBS Cucina & Amore Artichoke Bruschetta (it's both gluten-free & vegan)
  • 1 can Tuna (I used Chicken of the Sea Lite Tuna in Water) 
Directions:
  1. In a medium sized bowl, place the 4 tbs of artichoke bruschetta
  2. Open the can of tuna and drain any excess water
  3. Place the drained tuna in the bowl with the artichoke bruschetta
  4. Stir until evenly mixed

Option #1 - Sandwich

Obviously, the easiest way to eat this Artichoke & Bruschetta with Tuna is by making it a tuna sandwich alternative. It only requires 3 ingredients (bread, artichoke bruschetta, & tuna) and it's full of protein and fiber without the unhealthy additive of mayo.

Option #2 - Low Carb Lettuce Wrap

I'm always trying to find healthy low carb alternatives when I can. This lettuce wrap option is perfect for those who want a refreshing wrap without the carb guilt later.

Option #3 - Bruschetta Bites

You can always use the ingredients for what they were originally intended for. The combination of artichoke & tuna make the perfect appetizer for a party or a simple snack.

A Kitchen of Love from our Family to Yours!

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Delicious!

item.title: Biscotti Sugar Cookies
item.dc:creator: cucinaandamore
item.content:encoded:
This was another "a-ha" moment that I came across and was super excited to try. I kept thinking of different ways to incorporate our biscotti cookies. I wanted to go beyond the normal chocolate dipped biscotti. One thing that people love to eat are cookies. However, biscotti isn't always the first choice people think of when they are craving for some cookies. This recipe blends the traditional Italian cookie with some homemade sugar cookies. Serving Size: 12-24 Prep Time: 10-15 minutes Cook Time: 13-15 minutes Ingredients:
  • Cucina & Amore Biscotti cookies
    • Chocolate
    • Almond
    • Pistachio
    • Cranberry
  • Betty Crocker Sugar Cookie Mix
  • 1 egg
  • 1/2 cup of butter
Directions:
  1. Preheat the oven to 375°F
  2. Choose any flavor Biscotti you would like (I've used all 4 separately and they are equally delicious)
  3. Place all the biscotti cookies in a large ziplock bag
    • Can do less if you want less biscotti chunks 
  4. Take a rolling pin or a meat tenderizer and crush the biscotti until they are in chunks
    • Do not crush it too much, you still want there to be chucks of biscotti in the cookie
  5. Make the Sugar Cookie dough according to the package
    • In a medium bowl, blend the cookie mix, egg, and butter
  6. Add the crushed biscotti pieces to the sugar cookie dough
  7. Stir until the biscotti pieces are evenly mixed
  8. On a cookie sheet, place a heaping tablespoon of biscotti cookie dough
    • Space them about 2 inches apart  
  9. Bake for about 13-15 minutes depending on the oven
  10. Enjoy!

A Kitchen of Love from our Family to Yours!

item.title: Piquillo & Artichoke Turkey Meatballs
item.dc:creator: cucinaandamore
item.content:encoded:
I love simple recipes! I love it when you only need to put 2 ingredients together to make something you never thought would be so delicious. That's where Cucina & Amore comes in. Our quinoa meals, sauces, bruschettas, and vegetables make cooking simply that much easier. Who doesn't love easy-to-make, healthy food? I know I do! Serving Size: 4-6 Prep Time: 5 minutes Cook Time: 25 minutes Ingredients:
  • 4 TBS Cucina & Amore Piquillo & Artichoke Bruschetta
  • 1 package of Jennie O's Italian Seasoned Ground Turkey
Directions:
  1. Preheat the oven to 400°F
  2. Open the package of ground turkey and place into a medium-sized bowl
  3. Add 4 tbs of Piquillo & Artichoke Bruschetta
  4. Stir until the bruschetta is evenly mixed with the ground turkey
  5. On a baking sheet, place a heaping tablespoon of the piquillo, artichoke & turkey mix
  6. Bake for 25 minutes
  7. Enjoy!
Suggestions:
  • Use ground beef or chicken instead of turkey
  • Try another Cucina & Amore sauce
    • Artichoke Bruschetta
    • Sun-dried Tomato Bruschetta
    • Pesto alla Genovese (Basil Pesto)
  • Add some mozzarella cheese

A Kitchen of Love from our Family to Yours!

item.title: Pizza Zucchini Bites
item.dc:creator: cucinaandamore
item.content:encoded:
I think some of the greatest recipes can sometimes be found when you least expect it. 2 things that you would never think would come together so delightfully. Pizza and zucchini? Say what?! Yes, this unlikely duo can help satisfy your pizza craving without the carb-guilt later. And it only takes a few ingredients to make this healthy snack. As a fan once wrote, it's like a "diet pizza." We can only dream, but this one comes as close as any low-carb pizza alternative can. Find the original recipe by Delish. Serving Size: 2-4 Prep Time: 5-10 minutes Cook Time: 20 minutes Ingredients:
  • 1 medium zucchini
  • Cucina & Amore Basilico Pasta Sauce
  • Go Veggie Mozzarella Cheese Alternative
  • Cucina & Amore Fruttato Extra Virgin Olive Oil
  [gallery ids="2310,879" type="columns"] Directions:
  1. Preheat oven to 400°F
  2. Slice the zucchini
  3. Place zucchini slices on a baking sheet
  4. Lightly spread some Fruttato Extra Virgin Olive Oil on each zucchini slice
  5. Bake for 10 minutes
  6. Add the Basilico Pasta Sauce to each zucchini slice
  7. Top off each zucchini slice with as much Go Veggie Mozzarella you like
  8. Bake for another 10 minutes or until the cheese is melted or a light, crispy brown
  9. Enjoy!
Suggestions:
  • Add some pepperoni or sausage
  • Try another Cucina & Amore sauce
    • Sun-dried Tomato Pesto
    • Sun-dried Tomato Truffle Sauce
    • Pesto alla Genovese (Basil Pesto)
  • Use a different cheese like a Mexican Blend

A Kitchen of Love from our Family to Yours!

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Reblogged this on Shallow Thinking.

item.title: Puttanesca Pasta
item.dc:creator: cucinaandamore
item.content:encoded:
Do you love olives as much as I do? Sometimes, I find myself wondering how I could incorporate more olives in my recipes. With Cucina & Amore's Puttanesca Pasta Sauce, I can enjoy olives any time. Every jar of Puttanesca Pasta Sauce is full of green and black olives that deliver a delicious medley of flavor. Serving Size:4-6 Prep Time: 5 minutes Cook Time: 8-10 minutes Ingredients:
  • 1 jar Cucina & Amore Puttanesca Pasta Sauce
  • 1 box Cucina & Amore Organic Bronze-Cut Penne Rigate
Directions:
  1. Boil a pot of water
  2. Cook the pasta according to the instructions on the box
  3. In a saucepan, warm up the entire jar of Puttanesca Pasta Sauce on a low heat
  4. Add the sauce to the cooked pasta
  5. Enjoy!
Suggestions:
  • Add Italian sausage or beef
  • Use another Cucina & Amore sauce
    • Formaggio
    • Basilico
    • Arrabbiata
  • Try adding some cheese like parmesan

A Kitchen of Love from our Family to Yours!

item.title: Spicy Taco Quinoa Bowl
item.dc:creator: cucinaandamore
item.content:encoded:
I love it when a recipe comes together. I had my mind set on one thing and then all of a sudden, a new recipe pops into my head. It was better than I could have ever imagined! Have I mentioned how convenient our ready-to-eat quinoa meals are? They save me so much time in the kitchen, especially when I want to make something healthy, filling, and delicious. Less time being hangry (hungry + angry) and more time enjoying every bite of a tasty dish I made at home. This recipe is the perfect alternative to when you're craving Chipotle. Serving: 1-2 Prep Time: 5-10 minutes Cook Time: 5-10 minutes Ingredients:
  • Cucina & Amore Spicy Jalapeño Quinoa Meal
  • Jennie-O Taco Seasoned Ground Turkey
  • Romaine Lettuce
  • Avocado
Directions:
  1. In a skillet, grill the entire package of ground turkey
  2. Drain the excess oil from the cooked turkey
  3. Add the Spicy Jalapeño sauce from the quinoa meal to the turkey
    • Stir until the sauce is evenly mixed
  4. Chop up the romaine lettuce
  5. In a medium bowl, place the lettuce, quinoa from the quinoa meal, the spicy jalapeño & turkey mix, and top it off with some avocado
  6. Enjoy!
Suggestions:
  • Try ground beef instead of turkey
  • Use another Cucina & Amore quinoa meal
    • Artichoke & Roasted Peppers
    • Mango & Jalapeño
  • Add corn, onions, or roasted peppers

A Kitchen of Love from our Family to Yours!

item.title: Quinoa Crusted Chicken with Pesto
item.dc:creator: cucinaandamore
item.content:encoded:
Let's face it, I love quinoa! Any way I can incorporate it in my recipes, I am one happy gal. So when I came across a Quinoa Parmesan Recipe from Damn Delicious, I just knew I had to give it a try with my own unique twist. I figured, what else would pair perfectly with chicken? Why pesto, of course! And thus, my Quinoa Crusted Chicken with Pesto recipe was born.  Serving size: 2-4 Prep time: 15-20 minutes Cook time: 20-30 minutes Ingredients:
  • Cucina & Amore Basil Pesto Quinoa Meal
  • 2-3 boneless skinless chicken breasts
  • 1 TBS Italian Seasoning
  • 2 eggs
  • 1 cup flour
  • 1/4 cup shredded mozzarella cheese
Directions:
  1. Preheat oven to 400F
  2. Open the quinoa cup from the quinoa meal and place in a medium sized bowl
  3. Add the tablespoon of Italain seasoning to the quinoa and stir 
  4. In a small bowl, beat the 2 eggs
  5. Place the flour in another small bowl 
  6. Coat the chicken breast thoroughly with flour
  7. Dip the floured chicken in the eggs
  8. Coat the chicken with a layer of Italian seasoned quinoa 
  9. Place on a greased baking sheet
  10. Repeat with remaining chicken breasts
  11. Bake for 20-25 minutes (depending on the thickness of the chicken)
  12. Top the baked chicken with mozzarella 
  13. Bake for another 5 minutes or until cheese is fully melted
  14. Pour the pesto from the quinoa meal onto the chicken
  15. Enjoy!
Suggestions:
  • Use fish instead of chicken 
  • Try another Cucina & Amore Quinoa Meal
  • Artichoke & Roasted Peppers
  • Spicy Jalapeño 
  • Mango & Jalapeño
  •  Use Parmesan cheese

item.title: 10 Recipes using Pesto that are not Pasta
item.dc:creator: cucinaandamore
item.content:encoded:
Pesto is one of the most delicious sauces you can use in cooking. It's so versatile and makes everything taste better. When people think of pesto, they might instantly think of pasta, but you can use pesto for more than just the traditional pasta sauce. Here are 10 recipes you can use pesto that are not pasta. 

Pesto Garlic Monkeybread

Caprese Quinoa Salad

Pesto Chicken Quinoa with Zoodles

Mediterranean Flatbread

Pesto Crescent Rolls

Quinoa Crusted Chicken with Pesto

Artichoke Pesto Zoodles

Chicken Pesto Quinoa Bowl

Pesto Garlic Bread

Pesto Gnocchi

Cucina & Amore Pesto

  • Pesto alla Genovese (Basil Pesto)
  • Pesto alla Firenze (Artichoke Pesto)
  • Pesto alla Siciliana (Sun-dried Tomato Pesto)
  • Pesto alla Calabrese (Piquillo Pepper)

    • A Kitchen of Love from our Family to Yours!

item.title: Pesto Spinach Artichoke Chicken Bake
item.dc:creator: cucinaandamore
item.content:encoded:
Simple recipes are the best recipes. It's great when I come across a recipe when I keep nodding as I'm reading the ingredients because I just so happen to have all of them available. This is what happened to me when I found this Pesto Spinach Artichoke Chicken Bake recipe from The Pinning Mama. When she said that the recipe was easy, she meant it. I think the hardest thing about this recipe is saying its full name. Serving size: 3-6 Prep time: 10-15 minutes Cook time: 25-35 minutes Ingredients:
  • 3 boneless skinless chicken breasts
  • Cucina & Amore Pesto alla Genovese (Basil Pesto)
  • Cucina & Amore Grilled & Marinated Artichoke Hearts (halved)
  • Tomatoes (chopped)
  • Spinach
  • Italian Cheese Blend (shredded)
Directions:
  1. Preheat oven to 375F
  2. Place the chicken breasts in an oven-safe baking dish
  3. Top each chicken with as much pesto as you like
  4. Add the spinach and chopped tomatoes
  5. Drain the artichoke hearts and remove excess oil
  6. Add the artichoke hearts
  7. Top with as much Italian cheese blend as you prefer
  8. Bake for about 25-35 minutes depending on the oven and thickness of the chicken breasts
  9. Enjoy!
Suggestions: Try a different Cucina & Amore Pesto
  • Pesto alla Firenze (Artichoke Pesto)
  • Pesto alla Siciliana (Sun-dried Tomato Pesto)

A Kitchen of Love from our Family to Yours

item.title: Recipe Round-Up: 5 Recipes We Love
item.dc:creator: cucinaandamore
item.content:encoded: Gourmande in the Kitchens’ - Shiitake Mushrooms Stuffed With Olives and Sundried Tomatoes (Vegan, Paleo)  [caption id="attachment_2494" align="alignright" width="314"] Shiitake Mushrooms Stuffed with Olives and Sundried Tomatoes By: GourmandeintheKitchen.com[/caption] Gourmande in the Kitchen is a wonderful food blog focused on delicious, easy-to-prepare foods that are always gluten-free. Her shiitake mushroom recipe stuffed with olives is a taste bud’s dream come true. Although her kalamata olive and tomato filling is delicious, try substituting Cucina and Amore’s Sundried Tomato Pesto (Alla Siciliana) mixed with their black olive bruschetta. Topped with vitamin-rich greens and Cucina and Amore’s Extra Virgin Olive Oil, these healthy mushroom caps will be a hit with the whole family. Foodie Crush’s - Spring Vegetable Gnocchi [caption id="attachment_2496" align="alignleft" width="293"] Spring Gnocchi By FoodieCrush.com[/caption] Nothing says healthy and fresh like spring vegetables. Combine that with Cucina and Amore’s gluten-free gnocchi, and you have yourself a spring feast you might forget is vegetarian and wheat-free. The sauce contains leeks, vitamin-packed baby brown mushrooms, antioxidant-rich garlic, vitamin K rich peas, and cancer-fighting asparagus. If you want to make this vegan, forego the half and half and parmesan cheese by substituting avocado for the cream and nutritional yeast for the cheese. Your whole family will by full and asking for seconds! Healthy Blender Recipes’ -  Lentil, Zucchini, and Mint Salad  [caption id="attachment_2517" align="alignright" width="361"] Lentil Zucchini Mint Salad By Healthy Blender[/caption] An easy to prepare and even easier to eat meal, Healthy Blender Recipes’ Lentil, Zucchini, and Mint salad will keep you full from the high-fiber content and help lower bad cholesterol thanks to slowing digestion. Make sure you use Cucina and Amore’s soon-to-be-released lentils which are deliciously easy to prepare. Zucchini’s potassium levels reduce blood pressure, while the naturally-occurring magnesium keeps your heart beating at a steady rate. Make sure you use Cucina and Amore’s Extra Virgin olive oil, which also aids in lowering your cholesterol. Next time you need a cool, refreshing salad, opt for making this no-hassle recipe. Epicurean Vegan’s  - Mushroom and Spinach Truffle Oil Pizza [caption id="attachment_2499" align="alignleft" width="369"] Mushroom and Spinach Pizza by EpicureanVegan.com[/caption] Sometimes, you have to treat yourself to a decadent meal. This recipe from Epicurean Vegan adds nutrient-rich veggies like iron-packed spinach and vitamin D powerhouse mushrooms instead of greasy and fatty meats like pepperoni and ham. Rather than drizzling the pizza with truffle oil, try using one of Cucina and Amore’s three gourmet truffle sauces: their sundried tomato, basil pesto, or artichoke truffle sauces will make you smack your lips as you eat healthy slice after healthy slice of pizza. The Minimalist Baker’s - Kale & White Bean Artichoke Dip [caption id="attachment_2501" align="alignright" width="316"] Kale White Bean Artichoke Dip By MinimalistBaker.com[/caption] Who said tailgating and Super Bowl parties had to have unhealthy appetizers? This recipe from The Minimalist Baker, whose simple, delicious recipes require 10 ingredients or less, one bowl, or 30 minutes or less to prepare will keep hungry fans coming back for more. Make sure to use Cucina and Amore’s all-natural artichoke hearts and cannellini beans to make your dish. To bring it to the next level, use Cucina and Amore’s grilled & marinated artichoke hearts in place of the usual marinated kind. The fun doesn’t stop there when substituting Cucina and Amore’s products in these delicious recipes. You can always use Cucina and Amore's Extra Virgin Olive Oil and balsamic vinegar on your favorite salads, or drizzled over a delicious Caprese salad. They even have handpicked saffron to liven up paella or risotto! Cucina and Amore belongs in every gourmand’s pantry.

item.title: Low Carb Lasagna
item.dc:creator: cucinaandamore
item.content:encoded:
Do you ever feel the desire to cook a really good meal? Something that actually takes time and more than a handful of ingredients? I recently got the urge to cook and took full advantage of it and created something I have never made or eaten before. I've heard a lot of great things about spaghetti squash and using it as a low carb alternative to pasta, but I never found the time to actually make it. Now was my chance! I want to give you a heads up that this meal will take awhile to make, but I promise you it will be so worth the wait! This recipe was inspired by Low-Carb Mock Lasagna Spaghetti Squash Casserole from Kalyn's Kitchen. Serving Size: 6-8 Prep Time: 30 minutes Cook Time: 105 minutes Ingredients:
  • 1 large Spaghetti Squash
  • 1 jar Cucina & Amore Basilico Pasta Sauce
  • 5 Hot Turkey Italian Sausages (I used Jennie-O)
  • 2 cups Low fat Cottage Cheese (I used Knudsen Low Fat 2% milk fat, small curd)
  • 1 tsp Italian Seasoning (I used McCormick's)
  • Cucina & Amore Robusto Extra Virgin Olive Oil
  • 2 eggs
  • 8oz bag of Shredded Mozzarella cheese (I used Lucerne Low-Moisture, Part-Skim Mozzarella)
[gallery ids="2310,142" type="rectangular"] Directions:
  1. Preheat oven to 400°F
  2. Microwave the spaghetti squash for 5 minutes
  3. Cut the spaghetti squash lengthwise
  4. Remove all seeds and pulp
  5. Brush the inside of the spaghetti squash with the Robusto Extra Virgin Olive Oil
  6. Sprinkle the spaghetti squash with Italian seasoning
  7. Bake for 1 hour
  8. While the spaghetti squash is baking, remove the casings of each hot turkey Italian sausage
  9. In a frying pan, cook the loose sausage until it is completely browned
  10. Drain the excess grease from the cooked sausage and return to the frying pan
  11. On a low heat, add the Basilico Pasta Sauce to the cooked sausage, stirring occasionally
  12.  In a medium-sized bowl, mix the 2 cups of cottage cheese, 1 tsp Italian seasoning, and 2 eggs together
  13. Once the spaghetti squash is cooked, use a fork to shred the squash into spaghetti
  14. Reduce the oven to 375°F
  15. Spray an 8 inch by 11 inch casserole dish with nonstick spray
  16. Add a layer of shredded spaghetti squash, a layer of sausage & sauce, a layer of cottage cheese mix, and a layer of mozzarella cheese
  17. Repeat step #16 until there are 8 layers
  18. Bake for another 45 minutes
  19. Enjoy!
Suggestions:
  • Use Italian seasoned ground turkey
  • Try another Cucina & Amore Pasta Sauce
    • Puttanesca
    • Arrabbiata
    • Formaggio
  • Substitute mozzarella with an Italian Cheese Blend

A Kitchen of Love from our Family to Yours!

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Sounds delicious! So glad I could inspire you!

item.title: Sun-Dried Tomato Truffle, Cheese & Spinach Stuffed Chicken
item.dc:creator: cucinaandamore
item.content:encoded:
I love it when a recipe comes together. I had all of these ingredients in my fridge and it finally hit me when reading the Sun-dried Tomato, Spinach, and Cheese Stuffed Chicken recipe from Yammie's Noshery. I already had an open jar of Cucina & Amore's Sun-Dried Tomato Truffle Sauce and thought would be the perfect substitute for a regular sun-dried tomato. The touch of truffle took this main dish to a gourmet level! Serving Size: 1-2 Prep Time: 5-10 minutes Cook Time: 30 minutes

Ingredients:

  • Chicken breast
  • Cucina & Amore Sun-Dried Tomato Truffle Sauce
  • Spinach
  • Mozzarella
  • Cucina & Amore Robusto Extra Virgin Olive Oil
The ingredients are left to your own desire of how much you would like of each ingredient. Have some fun with it!  [gallery ids="2636,122" type="rectangular"]

Directions:

  1. Preheat oven to 375°F
  2. Cut the chicken breast lengthwise like a hotdog bun
  3. Spread the Sun-Dried Tomato Truffle Sauce on the inside of the chicken
  4. Add the mozzarella
  5. Add the spinach
  6. Close the chicken as best as you can
  7. Brush the top of the closed chicken breast with the olive oil
  8. Bake for 30 minutes
  9. Enjoy!
Suggestions:
  • Use whole sun-dried tomatoes
  • Try another Cucina & Amore Truffle Sauce
    • Basil Pesto
    • Artichoke
  • Add some feta cheese

A Kitchen of Love from our Family to Yours!

item.title: Biscotti Cheesecake Bites
item.dc:creator: cucinaandamore
item.content:encoded:
I sometimes get a craving for cheese and sometimes I get a craving for cake. Sometimes the cravings collide with a delicious combination known as cheesecake. I came across this recipe for No Bake Raspberry Cheesecake Bites from This Silly Girl's Life that I found on Pinterest. I thought it was the perfect way to satisfy my cheesecake craving and incorporate Cucina & Amore's most popular and unique Cranberry Almond Biscotti. Serving Size: 6-12 (depends on how hungry people are and how big or small you make the bites) Prep Time: 75 minutes (1 hour in the freezer and 15 minutes to make the bites) Cook Time: 60 minutes (1 hour in the freezer) Ingredients:
  • 10 cookies of Cucina & Amore Cranberry Almond Biscotti
  • 8oz of cream cheese
  • 1 cup of Cool Whip
  • 1/4 cup sugar
Directions:
  1. In a food processor, place the 10 Cranberry Almond Biscotti pieces and make them into crumbs
    • Do not leave any large chunks
  2. Place biscotti crumbs in a small bowl
  3. In a medium bowl, mix the softened cream cheese, Cool Whip, and sugar until well blended
  4. Freeze the cream cheese mixture for 1 hour
  5. After the hour, use a tablespoon to scoop the cream cheese mixture and roll into a ball
  6. Dip the cream cheese ball into the bowl of biscotti crumbs and roll it around until the ball is completely covered in biscotti crumbs
  7. Place the ball on a non-stick plate or container
  8. Continue steps #5-7 until the entire cream cheese mixture is gone
  9. Freeze the Biscotti Cheesecake Bites for another hour
  10. After the hour, let them thaw for about 5 minutes
  11. Enjoy!
Suggestions:
  • Try using another Cucina & Amore Biscotti
    • Almond
    • Pistachio
    • Chocolate
  • Add a fruit to the cream cheese mixture like strawberry or raspberry

A Kitchen of Love from our Family to Yours!

Tasty recipe!

item.title: Cucumber, Avocado & Tomato Salad with Pesto Vinaigrette
item.dc:creator: cucinaandamore
item.content:encoded:
Have you ever just had a hankering for something healthy? Something that you eat that just makes you think, I feel good for eating so well. This Cucumber, Avocado & Tomato Salad will do just that. It will make you feel healthy because it is healthy... it's made with Cucina & Amore's finest Extra Virgin Olive Oil and Basil Pesto. And it only takes a handful of ingredients to make! Serving Size: 4-6 Prep Time: 10-15 minutes Cook Time: 30 minutes Ingredients:
  • 4 mini cucumbers
  • 2 cherry tomatoes
  • 1 avocado
  • 1 tbsp Cucina & Amore Pesto alla Genovese (Basil Pesto)
  • 2 tbsp Cucina & Amore Fruttato Extra Virgin Olive Oil
  • Feta Cheese (optional)
Directions:
  1. Chop the cucumbers, tomatoes, and avocado into bite-sized pieces and place in a medium-sized bowl
  2. In a small bowl, stir the pesto and the olive oil together
  3. Pour the pesto vinaigrette onto the chopped vegetables
  4. Stir until all of the vegetables are evenly coated with pesto vinaigrette
  5. Refrigerate for 30 minutes to marinate
  6. Optional before Serving: Top with sprinkles of crumbled feta cheese
  7. Enjoy!
Suggestions:
  • Add some bell peppers
  • Try using Cucina & Amore Robusto Extra Virgin Olive Oil
  • Top with goat cheese

A Kitchen of Love from our Family to Yours!

item.title: Pesto, Sun-Dried Tomato & Brie Grilled Cheese
item.dc:creator: cucinaandamore
item.content:encoded:
I always like a nice grilled cheese sandwich, but sometimes I go a little fancier and kick it up a notch to that gourmet level. I came across the Brie, Pesto, and Sweet Pepper Grilled Cheese recipe from Two Peas & Their Pod, that is when I couldn't help but search my fridge and see what I had available. An acceptable substitute for the sweet pepper was Cucina & Amore Sun-Dried Tomatoes which suited me just fine. Serving Size: 1-2 Prep Time: 5-10 minutes Cook Time: 7-10 minutes Ingredients:
  • Ciabatta bread
  • Brie cheese
  • Cucina & Amore Pesto alla Genovese (Basil Pesto)
  • Cucina & Amore Sun-Dried Tomatoes
  • Cucina & Amore Fruttato Extra Virgin Olive Oil
[gallery ids="988,879,491" type="rectangular"] Directions:
  1. Cut the ciabatta bread in half
  2. Spread both sides with a light layer of basil pesto
  3. Chop up about 2 sun-dried tomatoes and place on one side of the sandwich
  4. Cut the brie into sections to add a layer of brie cheese on top of the sun-dried tomatoes
  5. Place the remaining bread slice on top of the sandwich
  6. Brush some olive oil on top of the ciabatta bread
  7. Heat up a frying pan on medium heat
  8. Place the olive oil topped-side of the sandwich down onto the pan
  9. Brush some olive oil on the bottom of the ciabatta bread
  10. Flip the sandwich over and repeat until the brie is ooey gooey and oh so delicious
  11. Enjoy!
Suggestions:
  • Add some artichokes
  • Use Cucina & Amore Piquillo Peppers
  • Try using provolone or mozzarella cheese

A Kitchen of Love from our Family to Yours!

item.title: 5 Easy Recipes for Labor Day
item.dc:creator: cucinaandamore
item.content:encoded:
Labor Day weekend is finally here. It's the last official 3 day weekend of summer to take you into the next school year and get you ready for the final months of the year. This weekend is filled with family, friends, fun, and BBQs. Here are 5 easy recipes you can make this Labor Day weekend.

Cucumber, Avocado & Tomato Salad with Pesto Vinaigrette

If you're looking to stay healthy at your Labor Day BBQ, try this vegetable-medley salad. The pesto vinaigrette is light yet brings out the flavor in each bite.

Pesto Tortellini Skewers

These Pesto Tortellini Skewers from Foody Schmoody are easy to make, fun to eat, and will be sure to make your guests say YUM! You only need 3 ingredients and some skewers and you've got yourself an appetizer that's sure to please. Use this recipe with Cucina & Amore's Basil Pesto. [caption id="attachment_2826" align="aligncenter" width="650"] Pesto Tortellini Skewers by Foody Schmoody[/caption]

Caprese Quinoa Salad

Forget that boring, typical pasta salad! Change things up with this healthier Caprese Quinoa Salad. It only takes 4 ingredients and with the help of our Basil Pesto Quinoa Meal, you don't have to worry or wait to cook your quinoa. This dish can be ready to enjoy in minutes!

Antipasto Platter

An Antipasto Platter is ideal for those who need to save time because there is absolutely no cooking involved. Thanks to this step by step guide from The Kitchen is My Playground, it has never been easier to make an Antipasto Platter of your very own. Try using some of Cucina & Amore's grilled & marinated artichoke hearts. [caption id="attachment_2885" align="aligncenter" width="640"] Antipasto Platter from The Kitchen is My Playground[/caption]

Pesto & Bruschetta Cheese Torta

Bring something new to the table with this unique Pesto & Bruschetta Cheese Torta. It's the perfect appetizer to get your BBQ started. It's great for all cheese lovers! Happy Labor Day! Now get cooking!

A Kitchen of Love from our Family to Yours!

item.title: With rising restaurant rates, more people eating homemade lunches
item.dc:creator: cucinaandamore
item.content:encoded:
Posted by the Chicago Tribune on September 14th, 2016 The Chicago Tribune stated that research published by The NPD Group, Inc., a large market research company that monitors consumer purchase trends nationwide,  indicates that more people are making their own lunches instead of going out to eat during the day due to rising restaurant prices.
“The decline in lunch traffic has been seen for a decade as more office workers sign-in from home. (Pajama-clad telecommuters are less likely to schedule business lunches.) Even the distraction of online shopping was credited for the decline, because it leads to fewer breaks for food. Weekday lunch traffic fell 7 percent.”   “But recent menu price increases have made the declines worse, NPD said. Average lunch checks for the spring quarter increased as much as 5 percent compared with the same period a year ago, NPD said.. That has moved meals beyond what some consumers are willing to pay, leading to lower customer satisfaction and fewer repeat visits.”
With this increasing trend for making your own lunch, people’s awareness and need for eating healthy during the workday has never been more important. People are continuously on the go and don’t have enough time to make their lunch, let alone, stop, sit, and eat it. The need for convenient, healthy and affordable meals is in high demand. Good thing, Cucina & Amore’s selection of delicious Quinoa Meals makes it easy for everyone. Read the original Chicago Tribune article here.

item.title: Baked Pesto Artichoke Rigatoni
item.dc:creator: cucinaandamore
item.content:encoded:
Pasta is the perfect meal when you want to cook a big dinner that doesn't take a lot of ingredients yet still is tasty enough for the whole family to enjoy. It's easy to simply boil water, cook the pasta, and stir in some sauce. But sometimes you want to take your pasta game to the next level by adding a few extra ingredients. That's where the Healthy Baked Pesto Rigatoni recipe from Pinch of Yum came to me at just the right time of hunger. It was the time when you know you're going to be hungry soon, but not quite there yet. Plenty of time to make the perfect Pesto Rigatoni but with a Cucina & Amore twist. Serving Size: 6-8 people Prep Time: 5-10 minutes Cook Time: 20-25 minutes Ingredients:
  • 1 box of Rigatoni pasta
  • 5 tbsp Cucina & Amore Pesto alla Genovese (Basil Pesto)
  • 1/2 cup cherry tomatoes (halved)
  • 1/2 cup Cucina & Amore Grilled & Marinated Artichoke (quartered)
  • 1/2 cup shredded Mozzarella cheese
[gallery ids="491,633" type="rectangular"] Directions:
  1. Cook the pasta following the directions on the box
  2. While the pasta is cooking, slice the cherry tomatoes in half
  3. Open the jar of artichokes, remove any excess oil from the artichokes
  4. Cut the artichokes in quarters and make into smaller pieces
  5. Preheat oven to 400°F
  6. Place cooked pasta into a large bowl
  7. Add the tomatoes, artichokes and basil pesto
  8. Stir until the pesto is evenly coated
  9. Transfer the pasta into a 9x13 baking dish
  10. Top off the pasta with mozzarella cheese
    • I know it says 1/2 cup, but you can add as much or as little as you want 
  11. Bake for 10 minutes
  12. Enjoy!
Suggestions:
  • Add some chicken
  • Try using another Cucina & Amore sauce
    • Artichoke Pesto
    • Sun-Dried Tomato Pesto
  • Use a different cheese like Asiago or Parmesan

A Kitchen of Love from our Family to Yours!

item.title: Healthy 5 Minute Meals
item.dc:creator: cucinaandamore
item.content:encoded:
Just because modern life is frenzied doesn’t mean you have to skip out on healthy and delicious meals. On their own, the Cucina & Amore Quinoa Meals are convenient, delicious, high in fiber, and a complete protein, but dazzle your taste buds with these hassle-free recipes to get your superfood on and keep your health in check.

Mediterranean Cucina & Amore Quinoa Salad

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZQR1ZhBAbGg Cucina & Amore Basil Pesto Quinoa Meal not only recalls the tastes of Italy, but provides a vitamin-packed alternative to pasta for those with a gluten intolerance. You can make it Greek by adding some feta cheese, olives, and artichoke hearts. Serving Size: 1-2 Prep Time: 5-8 minutes Cooking Time: 1-2 minutes Ingredients:
  • 1 package of Cucina & Amore Basil Pesto Quinoa meal
  • 4 oz of Cucina & Amore Grilled Marinated Artichoke Halves
  • 4 oz of cherry tomatoes
  • 4 oz of kalamata olives
  • ¼ cup of feta cheese crumbles
  • Juice from half of a lemon
Directions:
  1. In a medium sized bowl, place the already-cooked quinoa and basil pesto from the Quinoa Meal
  2. Cut cherry tomatoes in half.
  3. Lightly salt and pepper the tomatoes and set aside with the feta cheese crumbles.
  4. Roughly chop the olives and the artichokes. Mix together with the cherry tomatoes and feta cheese
  5. Add all ingredients with lemon juice to a bowl and toss together until well mixed.

Roasted Chicken Cucina & Amore Mango & Jalapeno Quinoa Meal

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AYZi4WD_s8k Cucina & Amore Mango & Jalapeno Quinoa Meal wakes up your taste buds with its sweet and spicy flavor combination, but why not kick it up a notch by adding a few, simple ingredients? Store-bought roasted chicken, avocado, and a squeeze of lime will have your mouth salivating for this nutritious meal with not one, but two superfoods. Serving Size: 1-2 Prep Time: 8-10 minutes Cooking Time: 0 minutes Ingredients:
  • 1 package of Cucina & Amore Mango & Jalapeno Quinoa Meal
  • 1 cup of roasted chicken
  • ½ of an avocado, cubed
  • ½ of a juiced lime
Directions:
  1. Cube or shred roasted chicken into bite-size pieces and set aside in a bowl.
  2. Cut avocado in half and remove core. Spoon out one half of the avocado and cut into bite-sized cubes.
  3. Add to the bowl of chicken.
  4. Drizzle lime juice over chicken and avocado cubes. Season with salt and pepper.
  5. Mix in Cucina & Amore Mango & Jalapeno Quinoa Meal with chicken and avocado, and enjoy!

Sautéed Spinach and Mushroom Cucina & Amore Artichoke & Roasted Peppers Quinoa Meal

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=98ym22I4ok4 This vegan upgrade to the already delicious Artichoke & Roasted Peppers Quinoa Meal will leave your belly full and your body thanking you with the addition of spinach and mushrooms. Next time you need a convenient, hassle-free meal, try this recipe: Serving Size: 1-2 Prep Time: 5-8 minutes Cooking Time: 5-8 minutes Ingredients:
  • 1 package of Cucina & Amore Artichoke & Roasted Peppers Quinoa Meal
  • 1 teaspoon of Cucina & Amore Fruttato Extra Virgin Olive Oil
  • 1 cup of spinach
  • 1 cup of chopped mushrooms
Directions:
  1. In a small pan, add olive oil and heat over medium-high heat.
  2. Add chopped mushrooms and brown until cooked through, about three minutes.
  3. Season with salt and pepper and set aside.
  4. In the same pan, add the spinach and cook until wilted, about 2 minutes.
  5. Remove from heat and place spinach in a paper towel or colander.
  6. Press to remove excess juices and roughly chop.
  7. Place the Cucina & Amore Artichoke & Roasted Peppers Quinoa Meal in a bowl, toss all ingredients together.
  8. Optional: add crumbled goat cheese for a creamy addition!

item.title: Spinach & Artichoke Dip Pizza
item.dc:creator: cucinaandamore
item.content:encoded:
Everyone that I know loves pizza! It's one of those staple foods that everyone can go to because there is something for everyone. This pizza combines the joys of 2 great party dishes: pizza and spinach & artichoke dip. This particular recipe was inspired by the Spinach & Artichoke Dip Pizza from Recipe Runner. When I first came across it, I thought it was brilliant and I just had to try it with fresh spinach and Cucina & Amore marinated grilled artichokes. So next time you're planning a party, just skip the dip and make this Spinach & Artichoke Dip Pizza instead. Serving Size: 4-8 Prep Time: 10-15 minutes Cook Time: 10-15 minutes Ingredients:
  • Pre-made Thin Crust Pizza (I used Boboli)
  • 2/3 cup Cucina & Amore grilled & marinated artichokes (chopped)
  • 1/2 spinach (chopped)
  • 4 oz low fat cream cheese (softened)
  • 2/3 cup mozzarella cheese (shredded)
  • 1/4 cup nonfat greek yogurt
  • 1 oz feta cheese
  • 1/4 tsp garlic powder
  • 1/4 tsp salt
Directions:
  1. Preheat oven to 450°F
  2. In a medium bowl, combine the softened cream cheese, greek yogurt, garlic powder and salt
  3. Add the chopped spinach, chopped artichokes, and 1/4 cup mozzarella cheese until well mixed
  4. Top the pre-made pizza crust with the spinach & artichoke dip and spread evenly
  5. Sprinkle the remaining mozzarella cheese on top
  6. Add the feta cheese as the finishing touches
  7. Bake for 10-15 minutes
  8. Enjoy!
Suggestions:
  • Add some chicken
  • Try adding some Cucina & Amore Sun-Dried Tomatoes
  • Use a different cheese topping like goat cheese or parmesan

A Kitchen of Love from our Family to Yours!

item.title: Sun-Dried Tomato Pesto Meatballs with Formaggio Pasta Sauce
item.dc:creator: cucinaandamore
item.content:encoded:
The best part about meatballs is that they are not all the same. There are so many different ways you can create a great tasting meatball that is perfect for you and your tastebuds. This time around, I was feeling very cheesy. I wanted something savory, not spicy, not herb-filled, just simply a savory meatball topped with a cheesy sauce. That's where Cucina & Amore Formaggio Pasta Sauce came in handy. This recipe was inspired by the Turkey Pesto Meatballs recipe by Mom.me. I made a few tweaks based on what I had on hand and what I was craving at the moment. Serving Size: 6-9 Prep Time: 10- 15 minutes Cook Time: 30 minutes Ingredients:
  • 1lb Jennie-O Ground Turkey
  • 1/4 cup Cucina & Amore Sun-Dried Tomato Pesto
  • 1/4 cup Parmesan cheese
  • 1/4 cup Italian Bread Crumbs
  • 1 jar Cucina & Amore Formaggio Pasta Sauce
https://youtu.be/4YKFZC80d0Y Directions:
  1. Preheat oven to 400°F
  2. In a medium bowl, combine the ground turkey, pesto, parmesan cheese, and Italian bread crumbs
  3. With a tablespoon, scoop out the mixture into meatballs and place into a single layer into a baking dish
  4. Top the meatballs with an entire jar of Formaggio Pasta Sauce
  5. Bake for 30 minutes
  6. Enjoy!
Suggestions:
  • Use ground chicken instead of turkey
  • Try another Cucina & Amore sauce
    • Basil Pesto
    • Arrabbiata Pasta Sauce
    • Basilico Pasta Sauce
  • Add mozzarella cheese

A Kitchen of Love from our Family to Yours!

item.title: Piquillo Pepper & Mango Salsa Chicken
item.dc:creator: cucinaandamore
item.content:encoded:
It takes two! Yes, only 2 ingredients to make this delicious, healthy, flavorful chicken. All you need is 2 lbs of boneless chicken breast and a jar of your favorite Cucina & Amore salsa. You will have protein for the whole family. It's also works wonders to spice up your regular meal prepping routine! This simple, yet wonderful 2-Ingredient Slow Cooker Salsa Chicken recipe is from Gimme Some Oven. Serving Size: 4-6 Prep Time: 5 minutes Cook Time: 3-4 hours https://youtu.be/GO3HcVcNQAo Ingredients:
  • 2lbs boneless chicken breast
  • 1 jar Cucina & Amore Piquillo Pepper & Mango Salsa
Directions:
  1. Place the chicken breast in one even layer in a crockpot/slow cooker
  2. Pour the entire jar of salsa evenly over the chicken
  3. Cook on high for about 3-4 hours
    • It all depends on the thickness of the chicken breast. Mine were small so it only needed 3 hours
  4. Shred the chicken with 2 forks
    • If the chicken is fully cooked, the meat should shred easily
  5. Enjoy!
Suggestions:
  • Use another Cucina & Amore Salsa
    • Fire Roasted Red Pepper
    • Fire Roasted Yellow Pepper
  • Add a squeeze of fresh lime juice
  • Sprinkle some salt and pepper onto the chicken before you pour on the salsa

A Kitchen of Love from our Family to Yours!

item.title: Caprese Artichoke Baguette
item.dc:creator: cucinaandamore
item.content:encoded:
This easy Caprese Artichoke Baguette is the perfect starter to any meal. With only a handful of ingredients, this cheesy gourmet appetizer will be the hit at your next party especially with its unique ingredient of Cucina & Amore Artichoke Pesto. Serving size: 10-12 Prep Time: 10-15 minutes Cook Time: 15-20 minutes Ingredients:
  • 1 loaf of Italian Bread
  • Cucina & Amore Pesto alla Firenze (Artichoke)
  • Mozzarella cheese
  • Cherry Tomatoes (halved)
  • Cucina & Amore Balsamic Vinegar of Modena
https://youtu.be/EFGAnatGm0E Directions:
  1. Preheat oven to 375°F
  2. Cut Italian bread in half
  3. Spread both sides with Artichoke Pesto
  4. Place the mozzarella slices and halved cherry tomatoes evenly along the bread
  5. Sprinkle with pepper to taste (optional)
  6. Bake for 15-20 minutes (until cheese is melted)
  7. Drizzle with balsamic vinegar
  8. Slice into serving sizes
  9. Enjoy!
Suggestions:
  • Add some chicken
  • Try using another Cucina & Amore Pesto
    • Basil Pesto
    • Sun-dried Tomato Pesto
  • Top with another vegetable like zucchini or eggplant

A Kitchen of Love from our Family to Yours!

item.title: Quinoa Stuffed Zucchini Boats
item.dc:creator: cucinaandamore
item.content:encoded:
Have you ever looked at a recipe and thought, "That looks good. I'm going to make that!" That's exactly what happened when I came across the Black Bean & Quinoa Stuffed Zucchini from Yummy Healthy Easy. I knew this would be a great way to incorporate a Cucina & Amore Quinoa Meal. It makes cooking so much faster and convenient. The quinoa is already cooked and the sauce takes care of all the intended spices in the recipe.   Serving Size: 6 Prep Time: 10-15 minutes Cook Time: 40 minutes Ingredients:
  • 3 medium sized zucchini
  • 1 package Cucina & Amore Spicy Jalapeño Quinoa Meal
  • 1/2 cup Black Beans
  • 1/2 cup low fat Cottage cheese
  • 1/2 cup Mexican Cheese Blend (shredded)
Directions: 
  1. Preheat oven to 350°F
  2. Cut each zucchini in half
  3. Microwave for 5 minutes
  4. Scoop out the inside of each zucchini
  5. Place zucchini boat into a 9x13 baking dish
  6. In a medium bowl, mix together the quinoa, black beans, cottage cheese, and jalapeño sauce
  7. Scoop the quinoa and black beans mixture into each zucchini boat
  8. Top each zucchini boat with as much cheese as you like
  9. Bake for 40 minutes
  10. Enjoy!
Suggestions:
  • Add ground beef or turkey
  • Try using another Cucina & Amore Quinoa Meal
    • Artichoke & Roasted Pepper
    • Mango & Jalapeño
    • Basil Pesto
  • Use a different cheese like Italian cheese blend or Mozzarella
https://youtu.be/FojdtY_5aN8

A Kitchen of Love from our Family to Yours!

item.title: Spicy Taco Bake
item.dc:creator: cucinaandamore
item.content:encoded:
There are many different name that this recipe could be called, casserole, bake, or even lasagna. Whatever you call it, it is bound to be delicious. It brings in unique flavors of Cucina & Amore's savory Fire Roasted Yellow Pepper Salsa, formerly known as California Wonder. But it's no wonder why it's so delicious. This blend of yellow peppers and garlic is the perfect answer to any mild salsa lovers. The Taco Casserole recipe from Key Ingredient is one of the best alternatives to normal Mexican food. It's simple, delicious, and fun to make. https://youtu.be/ha9xIH9iYeg Serving Size: 6-8 Prep Time: 15-20 minutes Cook Time: 20 minutes Ingredients:
  • 1.5lbs ground beef
  • 1 jar Cucina & Amore Fire Roasted Yellow Pepper Salsa
  • 1 cup black beans
  • 1/2 cup Mexican Cheese Blend
  • Cucina & Amore Tricolor Jalapeños (optional) 
  • Tortilla Chips
  • Cucina & Amore Robusto Extra Virgin Olive Oil
Directions:
  1. Heat a skillet to medium heat
  2. Coat the skillet with Robusto Extra Virgin Olive oil
  3. Add the ground beef to the heated skillet and cook until browned
  4. Drain the ground beef of any extra juices then return to skillet
  5. Under low heat, add the entire jar of Fire Roasted Yellow Pepper Salsa to the ground beef and mix well
  6. Preheat oven to 375°F
  7. In a baking dish, add a layer of tortilla chips
  8. Add a layer of mixed ground beef & yellow pepper salsa
  9. Add a layer of 1/2 cup black beans
  10. Add a layer of 1/4 cup Mexican Cheese blend
  11. Add another layer of tortilla chips
  12. Add another layer of mixed ground beef & yellow pepper salsa
  13. Add another layer of 1/2 cup black beans
  14. Optional: Add a layer of Tricolor Jalapeños for an extra spicy kick
  15. Top it off with 1/4 cup Mexican Cheese blend
  16. Bake for 20 minutes
  17. Enjoy!
Suggestions:
  • Use Taco Seasoned Ground Turkey or ground chicken
  • Try another Cucina & Amore Salsa
    • Fire Roasted Red Pepper
    • Piquillo Pepper & Mango
  • Add corn or onions or top with avocado

A Kitchen of Love from our Family to Yours!

item.title: Quinoa & Chicken Lettuce Wraps
item.dc:creator: cucinaandamore
item.content:encoded:
Some of the best recipes are those that are simple that only need a handful or less of ingredients. These recipes are fast, convenient, and more often than not, delicious. With the convenience of a Cucina & Amore Quinoa Meal and rotisserie chicken, these lettuce wraps can be made in just a few minutes because there is no cooking necessary! This recipe was inspired by the Buffalo Chicken Lettuce Wrap recipe from Sugar Dish Me. Instead of Buffalo sauce, I decided to use the Spicy Jalapeño Quinoa Meal to get that spicy heat. Serving Size: 3-4 Prep Time: 10-15 minutes Cook Time: 0 minutes Ingredients:
  • 3-4 Romaine lettuce leaves
  • 1 package Cucina & Amore Spicy Jalapeño Quinoa Meal
  • 1/2 cup rotisserie Chicken Breast
  • 1/2 diced avocado
Directions:
  1. Clean the Romaine lettuce leaves
  2. Scoop the ready-to-eat quinoa (from the quinoa meal) onto the clean Romaine lettuce
  3. Add the pieces of rotisserie chicken breast
  4. Top with the Spicy Jalapeño Sauce from the quinoa meal
  5. Finish by adding the diced avocado
  6. Enjoy!
https://youtu.be/_OU0uBcdWMQ Suggestions:
  • Try using ground beef or turkey
  • Use another Cucina & Amore Quinoa Meal
    • Mango & Jalapeño
    • Artichoke & Roasted Pepper
    • Basil Pesto
  • Add some cheese like Mexican Cheese Blend or Pepper Jack

item.title: Pesto Shrimp Quinoa
item.dc:creator: cucinaandamore
item.content:encoded:
Pesto + Shrimp + Quinoa = Protein Perfection! You only need 2 ingredients for this protein packed recipe, a Cucina & Amore Basil Pesto Quinoa Meal and some shrimp. It only takes a few minutes to cook the shrimp or if you're feeling extra fancy, you can always buy cooked shrimp. Either way, it's a delicious meal packed with a pesto-y protein punch! Serving Size: 1-2 Prep Time: 5 minutes Cook Time: 5-10 minutes Ingredients:
  • 1 package of Cucina & Amore Basil Pesto Quinoa Meal
  • 1/2 cup cooked shrimp
Directions:
  1. In a medium bowl, pour the ready-to-eat quinoa (from the Quinoa Meal)
  2. Add the cooked shrimp
  3. Pour on as much pesto (from the Quinoa Meal) as you like
  4. Stir until evenly mixed
  5. Enjoy!
Suggestions:
  • Use chicken instead of shrimp
  • Try a different Cucina & Amore Quinoa Meal
    • Mango & Jalapeño
    • Artichoke & Roasted Peppers
    • Spicy Jalapeño
  • Add some broccoli or other vegetables

item.title: Bruschetta Cucumber Roll Ups
item.dc:creator: cucinaandamore
item.content:encoded:
As we all know, the holidays are just around the corner. That means parties and get togethers and that means food. Lots and lots of food! One way to make sure you will be able to find something healthy to eat is to bring it yourself. That's where these easy to make Bruschetta Cucumber Roll Ups come in handy. Cucina & Amore has done all the work for you in creating one-of-a-kind bruschettas that can be enjoyed with practically everything, even cucumbers. This recipe was inspired by PaperBlog. Serving Size: 8-12 Prep Time: 10-15 minutes Cook Time: 0 minutes Ingredients:
  • Cucina & Amore Artichoke Bruschetta
  • 1 large cucumber
https://youtu.be/zuSj3Lrypus Directions:
  1. Using a vegetable slicer, cut the cucumber into long thin slices
  2. With a paper towel, remove as much excess water as you can from each slice of cucumber
  3. Take one cucumber slice at a time, spread the bruschetta evenly onto the middle of the cucumber
  4. Roll the cucumber up
    • Not too tight! Don't want the bruschetta to squeeze out the sides
  5. Secure with a toothpick
  6. Serve chilled and Enjoy!
Suggestions:
  • Try another Cucina & Amore Bruschetta
    • Piquillo & Artichoke
    • Sun-dried Tomato
    • Black Olive

item.title: Top 5 Reasons to Choose Quinoa Instead of Rice
item.dc:creator: cucinaandamore
item.content:encoded:
Rice is a mainstay for many dinners, either served as a side, underneath teriyaki chicken, or in soups. White rice has little nutritional value compared to the superfood quinoa.  Quinoa is a complete protein packed with vitamins and minerals. Instead of using rice during your next meal, replace it with quinoa for a healthier alternative.

Fiber

One cup of quinoa contains 5 grams of fiber. Studies show that quinoa is much higher in fiber than most grains, which makes it a better option to use during your meals instead of rice. Eating fiber has been known to help reduce blood sugar and help lower cholesterol when eaten regularly. It also has been shown to increase fullness, which means that you will eat less. With this in mind, quinoa makes a superior choice over rice when eaten regularly.

A Complete Protein

Quinoa contains 8 grams of protein per cup. Protein is needed to help our body function and is composed of amino acids. Humans cannot produce all of the necessary or essential amino acids,we can only get them through our diet. Lucky for us, Quinoa has all of the necessary amino acids, making it a complete protein. Because of this, quinoa is a great source of protein for vegans and vegetarians.

Low Glycemic Index

For those of us with blood sugar issues, quinoa is a great option because it has a low glycemic index. This means that quinoa will not raise blood sugar levels quickly. Blood sugar irregularities have been know to cause certain types of diabetes, weight gain, heart disease, and obesity. If you are trying to avoid these health issues, reach for quinoa for your next meal.

Packed with Vitamins and Minerals

Unlike white rice, quinoa contains numerous vitamins and minerals essential for the body to function. Quinoa contains important minerals including magnesium, potassium, zinc and iron. Quinoa contains large amounts of all four minerals, which can be lacking in our modern diet. If you don’t soak quinoa before cooking it, however, it is difficult for the body to absorb these minerals, so make sure you soak before cooking. Quinoa also contains folate, phosphorous, and copper, all minerals the body needs. Finally, quinoa also contains many of the B-complex vitamins and vitamin E, both of which are needed to keep you healthy.

Taste

Lastly, choose quinoa for the taste! Unlike white rice, quinoa has a rich, nutty taste and can be cooked in a variety of ways. By using quinoa instead of rice for your next teriyaki bowl, the quinoa will compliment the sesame seeds sprinkled on top. If you add to your vegetable soup instead of rice, you will have a delicious and protein-packed quinoa meal. Quinoa can even be added to salads to make them even healthier. Instead of making a pasta salad, try a quinoa salad—no one will miss the carb. And instead of a gluten-rich pasta, you can use quinoa which is naturally gluten free.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: very informative!!

item.title: Arrabbiata Pasta with Italian Turkey & Spinach
item.dc:creator: cucinaandamore
item.content:encoded:
Pasta is great because there are so many different combinations you can make. Sometimes I want to keep it simple and have only the pasta and the Cucina & Amore pasta sauce. Other times I'm feeling a little more adventurous and want to add a little extra to really liven up the dish. Any way you want it, pasta is always an easy and delicious way to do some creative cooking. So when I came across the Pasta Skillet with Chicken Sausage & Spinach recipe from Simply Recipes, I was inspired to add some extra ingredients to my next pasta meal. I didn't have a skillet and went with the alternative as mentioned in the original recipe. Serving Size: 8-12 people Prep Time: 10 minutes Cook Time: 20-30 minutes Ingredients:
  • 1 package Cucina & Amore Organic Bronze Cut Penne
  • 1 jar Cucina & Amore Arrabbiata Pasta Sauce
  • 1 package Jennie-O Italian Seasoned Ground Turkey
  • 4 cups Spinach
  • 1.5 cups shredded Italian Cheese Blend
Directions:
  1. Cook the pasta according to the directions on the package
  2. In a sauce pan on medium heat, cook all of the ground turkey until completely browned
  3. Drain the excess juices from the ground turkey and return to the sauce pan
  4. On low heat, add the Arrabbiata pasta sauce to the ground turkey and mix well
  5. Add the spinach to the ground turkey with pasta sauce until all of the spinach is wilted
  6. Pour the cooked pasta into a large bowl
  7. Add the turkey & spinach pasta sauce and stir until evenly mixed
  8. Pour 1/2 cup of the Italian Cheese blend and stir until it is mixed well and the cheese is melted
  9. Continue to add the remaining 1 cup of Italian Cheese blend until all the cheese is melted
  10. Enjoy!
  Suggestions:
  • Use ground beef or Italian sausage
  • Try another Cucina & Amore Pasta Sauce
    • Basilico
    • Puttanesca
    • Formaggio
  • Add some mushrooms or onions

A Kitchen of Love from our Family to Yours!

item.title: How to Pair Your Pasta Sauces
item.dc:creator: cucinaandamore
item.content:encoded:
A quick guide for what proteins pair with each Cucina & Amore Pasta Sauce 

Sometimes combining pasta with a delicious pasta sauce from Cucina & Amore is all you need to enjoy your evening meal. Although, you can always bring your Cucina & Amore dish to the next level by combining it with an organic protein to make your meal even more appetizing than it was before. Try adding one of these proteins to your Cucina & Amore Pasta Sauce the next time you want a simple and delectable dinner. Your taste buds will not be disappointed!

Tomato with Basil Pasta Sauce (Basilico)

 Traditionally, Bolognese sauce is made by browning ground beef and mixing it with a straightforward tomato sauce. Make your recipe better by using Cucina & Amore Basilico Pasta Sauce. You can then add seasoned ground beef to make a delicious meal. First, brown the beef and strain the unwanted fat, then warm it up with Cucina & Amore tomato with basil sauce. Make sure to choose grass-fed and organic beef to ensure you have the healthiest meal possible. If you are beef-averse, try it with organic ground turkey, chicken, or pork!

Puttanesca Pasta Sauce

Puttanesca sauce was first created in Southern Italy during the mid-20th century. Made with tomatoes and a medley of sliced olives, Cucina & Amore Puttanesca Pasta Sauce creates the perfect sauce for a savory dinner. Make sure that you add a protein to make it more filling by adding line-caught tuna or sustainably-harvested shrimp. Simply drain a can of tuna and chop into chunks before adding to the Puttanesca sauce. Or you can use shrimp by quickly grilling them with Cucina & Amore Fruttato Extra Virgin Olive Oil and lemon juice before adding them to the sauce. Once you add your proteins, toss in spaghettini or penne pasta after draining to absorb all of the flavor. If you love olives, then you’ll love this Puttanesca Pasta dish.

Arrabbiata Pasta Sauce

Nothing says spicy Italian pasta sauce like Cucina & Amore Arrabbiata Pasta Sauce. Arrabbiata, meaning “angry” in Italian, is a pasta sauce infused with red pepper flakes. This one is not for the faint of heart! To tone down the spiciness of the sauce, try adding sweet Italian sausage or turkey to the pasta. You can either slice the sausages or remove the casing to have bits of sausage in every bite. Top your fresh-cooked pasta with chopped parsley and freshly grated Pecorino Romano cheese and your whole family will be asking for seconds! 

Formaggio Pasta Sauce

One way to make your regular tomato sauce better is by adding cheese, but if you don’t have time to grate, pick up Cucina & Amore Formaggio Pasta Sauce. Made with tomatoes, ricotta ,and Parmigiano-Reggiano cheeses, this pasta sauce will satisfy any cheese lover's craving. Adding sliced, grilled chicken to your pasta will give your meal a whole new dynamic. You can also use the Formaggio Pasta Sauce in place of regular pasta sauce for your traditional Parmesan chicken recipe.
